text:
Firstly, this was my first visit. 

Just to reiterate.....service is well below par. With that being said the food is meh. It is neither good nor bad. My boyfriend and I were hungry so we tried one of the combo platters made for two. It had steak (salty, chewy, and overcooked), chicken (seasoning was minimal and it also was overcooked) and lastly pork (this was the best meat on the plate). It also included white rice which was ok and some plantains. I ordered the empanadas....one beef and one chicken. This was the highlight of the meal. Beef was better but I did enjoy both. Lastly, you are supposed to get bread with the meal....like many restaurants it comes before your meal. I asked once we received the main course and our waitress said that they were out. Probably something you disclose at the beginning of the meal. Well come to find out, they were not out. I'm sure she noticed my unhappiness with this news and came out a minute latter saying that they would have it right out. So basically she lied.....not sure how you go from being out to all of a sudden having some stashed in the back??? 

Needless to say probably won't be coming back. If anything....I would order the $2 empanadas and call it a night.

We walked in without a reservation, we were told they did not have any tables available but we were welcome to sit at the bar. We did, the bartender was great. The food was fantastic. We live in TN and we are trying to think of reasons to go back to Charlotte

This is sad. We liked the upbeat live Cuban band music. People were dancing up a storm and having a great time to the beat. The decor is attractive and the food, while not spectacular, is good. However, they water the mixed drinks at A Piece of Havana, an action so fundamentally dishonest that my partner and I will never go there again. I ordered a Mojito with Bacardi Superior rum. It contained zero rum--water, ice, and mint for flavor. When I sent it back they took it off the bill but without a word of apology. For me this is a deal breaker. For you, well, caveat emptor.

Been here a few times and have yet to write a review well here it is... the food is delicious and the sangria superb... Enjoyed dinner tonight and each and every time I go here I enjoy the food, drinks and cozy atmosphere...oh I almost forgot on Saturday nights the live music is really nice.

The food here is decent, but not completely authentic- and the quality seems to be a little hit or miss. Sometimes we'd go and everything would be fine, other times the rice would be bad or something else not made right, over-seasoned, under-seasoned, etc.

If you're looking for authentic Cuban food, you're much better off making the drive out to Rock Hill and hitting the Carlos Cafe.

My girlfriend and I stopped in one day since I've always wanted to try the place and pass it all the time on the way to Club Fitness. We ordered some sangria and Havana Sampler to start. The sangria, turnover and plantains were delicious. The fried pork chunks, meat balls, and fried yuca were very bland and overcooked/dry. We also got the roasted chicken which is supposedly a house specialty. The portion was huge but the sides and chicken itself were again bland and overcooked. 

OVerall, this would have gotten the place at least a "meh" and two stars. However, the service was absolutely terrible. I never like it when servers interrupt you during a meal and ask how it's going while you're still chewing on a large forkfull but at Piece of Havana I had to get up and ask for an extra silverware despite trying to flag down a waiter making his rounds. I then had to wait abnormal lengths of time to get a water refill. At that time I also requested a sangria refill but by the time it came out we were already done with our meal! I then had to get up again and go to the hostess station to ask for my check! Very inattentive service led us to not even order the tres leches dessert which I've heard is fantastic. This is too bad since I won't be back.

Randomly drove by and I don't drive by a Cuban restaurant without trying it. Ambiance was good and service was quick. I ordered the pork with rice and black beans, it was delicious. Not the best I've ever had but, worth having again. Mojito was pretty good too. With two drinks and two entrees, meal came out to 35$... Can't beat that.

Disgrace that they would even serve croquetas like this. And to top it off they aren't even filled it's almost as if injected. I would say save your money for a flight to get some real Cuban food in south Florida.

LOVED!!  I went recently with a group and loved everything I ordered.  We had the empanada and croquette appetizer.  So good.  Came with 4 (3 different) delicious empanadas...ham, chicken, and beef.  The avocado dip was perfect and came with plantain chips that I could have eaten by itself.

Split the shredded beef and Milanese chicken entrees.  Both very good...I couldn't decide which one I like better.  Side of sweet plantains and yellow rice were both delicious.  We all agreed the yellow rice was better than the congri.

Had tres leches cake for dessert and was perfect.  I am a chocolate lover and preferred this cake over the chocolate crepes that we also ordered.

Only complaint was one person had the pork and it was a little overcooked.  Overall great food and live music was a plus.  Can't wait to go back!!

Try the chicken and fried beef, this place is your traditional Cuban joint and one of the few that is really good in this area. Be prepared to wait a little while, but that is usually standard at most authentic Cuban places. You will not leave hungry.  They have a live band on weekends.
Excellent Cuban restaurant and with very reasonable prices.  I have never had a bad meal here and love their crispy shredded beef, but I had the mojo pork the other day and it was great as well.

Delicious! The palamillo steak, roasted pork, black beans, and plantains were amazing. One of the best mojitos I've ever had. There was a large celebration that took up half the restaurant and the food and service was still excellent. We can't wait to go back.

The first thing that impressed me was the daily specials. In my opinion, that is never a bad idea, especially on drinks. They had a decent bar selection and their mojito came highly recommended. I love Cuban sandwiches, so I couldn't wait to try the "Milanese", a breaded beef steak or chicken breast, with lettuce, tomatoes, ham and cheese in Cuban bread. They use American cheese in the sandwich and when I tried to order it with Swiss or Jack (my twist) the server looked confused and slightly hesitated, so I just let it ride with the American cheese as-is. My friend ordered the homemade chips and guacamole and it was really good. My sandwich was good, it came with a side and they featured a good bottled beer special that night. We also got a mojito and it was actually as good as word of mouth. The Menu appetizers include Papa Rellena (Stuffed Potato with ground beef), Empanadas and Tostones Rellenos de Camarones. Entrees include such specialties as Arroz con Pollo, Bistec de Palomilla, the very popular Paella from Spain (a seafood mix with Saffron yellow seasoned rice cooked with beer) and ropa vieja (Shredded Beef) a traditional Cuban dish. They have a decent selection of wines, Latin-American cocktails, domestic and imported beers as well as their famous Mojitos. They also have Cuban style sangrias by the glass and by the pitcher. 

The design of the dining room is a re-creation of the early 1900's in Havana, Cuba. Although it's not as authentic as it could be, It does create a warm and cozy feel. The chandeliers make the room sort of dimly lit and romantic. There is a lot of Cuban art on the walls and they play Cuban music for background ambiance through the week, with live music and DJ's on the weekends. This seems like the type of place my man Ernie Hemingway would have visited in La Bodeguita del Medio in Havana to get loaded on Mojitos and Daiquiris, then fall into a hammock and scrimshaw a few classics. Ah yes, Big Ern was a wild boy. No doubt. A Piece of Havana features live music every Friday & Saturday from 7PM to 10PM. Fridays are "Havana Nights" with a DJ spinning International music. If you're not too familiar with Cuban cuisine, start with sandwiches and salads and work your way up the menu.

This place is doing Cuban food right. I've been here several times and will continue to come for as long as they're open. Staff and servers have always been friendly and I've never experienced any long delays. Food has always been exceptional in presentation and taste. For those who aren't sure of what to order for the first time. I recommend going with the ropa veja and crocettas as an appetizer.

Excellent food! The oxtails will keep you addicted, as will the guacamole! So many good things, just pick something and enjoy!

Service is terrible, even for a simple call in and pick up, Especially if you don't speak Spanish.

They used to have dancing to spanish language music on the weekends.  If they still do, it's a great time with no fighting or negative issues of any kind.

The food was good. Mojitos were average. Cool ambience. Friendly service. ... But for a party of 2 I feel that we waited too long on a day that Wasn't busy for our drink then food order to be taken. 

Lots of personalized decor adds a nice touch to the feel of the restaurant. 


I can still confidently recommend,but I worry about the speed of service on a busy night. 

I had the shredded crispy beef.  .  Pretty good !
If your wanting to hear live cuban music, And taste it too you have to come to come to POH!! and don't forget to try a mojito or yummy sangria YOU WILL FALL IN LOVE!!

I wanted to have great experience here. Came with my husband for a date night with a reservation. We were 10 min early and seated right away. But experienced long wait time just see a waitress and order drinks. The food was was ok but what really upset us is that after we got our food we did not see a waitress until we had to ask for to give us our checks! This was a hour wait. This was very frustrating being that it's a nice place with live music. I hope they get this together.

Hands down this place has the best mojitos in Charlotte!!!  This is the first restaurant that I've been to in this city that puts fresh fruit in their mojitos, I recommend the strawberry and mango ones.

The decor and overall atmosphere is really enjoyable, we went on a Friday night when they had live Cuban music.  We were also told that later that night, they'd open up the dance floor for salsa night.

The service was very prompt initially, actually too prompt.  I've always had a pet peeve around being given my entree less than 5 minutes after you brought my salad out.  Other than that one slip up, the rest of the service that night was excellent.

The food was very fresh and tasty.  I had the calamari, chicken Caesar salad and the Havana Pork.  The calamari was very fresh and had a nice tangy dipping sauce on the side.  I only had a couple bites of the chicken Caesar before my Havana Pork came out, so I can't really comment on the salad since I just had them trash that.  The Havana pork was nicely seasoned and extremely tender.  Based on the way the pork was cooked, I'd recommend their pork dishes to anyone.

Pricing is very reasonable, most entrees run between $7-16.  If you're looking for good Cuban food, A Piece of Havana is a great place to go.

Catered lunch from here today. OMG! So good (this coming from someone that lived in S. Florida for 5 yrs so I know good cuban food) We ordered Lechon, Picadillo, Sweet Plantains, Black Beans & Rice, and green beans.

Went on 8/25/13 during a short visit to Charlotte. Appetizer was excellent -- croquetas and empanadas. The main courses were good, but not necessarily the Cuban taste that I grew up with. Service was good, ambiance is nice, bar looked very well stocked.

The food is authentic and tasty. BUT, the music last night was so loud that it diminished the enjoyment of an otherwise delicious meal. We told the waitress, who was lovely, but nothing changed. I will not go back because of it. Too bad,,,,

While visiting Charlotte, my group decided on Cuban food for dinner.  I am so glad we chose A Piece of Havana.  The entire experience was amazing!  Service was great.  Food was SPECTACULAR (huge portions)!  The vibe is really cool.  We went on a Friday night and they had a group performing. There is a small dance floor where patrons could salsa and mambo.  It was so much fun!  If you're nearby, be sure to check it out.

I love this place. Everyone is super friendly and the food is fabulous. I always get the roast pork with the Congris (Black beans and rice) and a bowl of soup on the side. Everything is made from scratch and is always hot and delicious. The roast pork is so tender and the mojo sauce they do it with is incredible. Sweet, tangy and delish. I always walk out full for 9 bucks. And that's with a tip. They even have a card now so that after you buy 6 lunches you get one free. Can't beat that.

The worst servers ever! It's a good thing that the food is good. I sat outside  and got no service what so ever. I had to go in to order, get my check and pay! They tend to forget the tables outside.  There is nothing worst to me than bad service. Service completes your overall dining experience. What a shame!!

I had mouth already to eat some cuban food.  Then instead I got served really bad greasy Mexican food.  Yuck couldn't even eat half of it.  Charlotte is in such desperate need of a good cuban restaurant! At least I can get a decent Cuban sandwich from Publix.

It seems like a lot of people reviewing this place as not being too great aren't very familiar with Cuban food to begin with. If you are familiar with it and enjoy it, you'll like this place. 

I'm native to the Tampa Bay area of Florida so I'm quite familiar with the cuisine. The food here is excellent and seasoned well, the atmosphere is quite beautiful and the staff is personable. I had the Palomilla Sirloin Steak and it was delicious. Their homemade tres leches cake is also intensely delicious (extremely moist yet not mushy), and their Cuban shakes are very good too.
Excelente servicio y la comida riquísima  recomendable la comida salió rápido muy atentos a todo los postres muy ricos me hizo el día este restaurant
Muy buena comida,excelente musica en vivo,clases de baile y ambiente latino ideal para un viernes en la noche
Between the crispy shredded beef, chicken havan, and skirt steak you can not go wrong with this place.  Everyone there is very nice and the mojitos are delicious!

I will give this restaurant a  big 0. They  don't have any respect for the costumers. I don't care is the food is acceptable, but the service at this place is really poor. Mangement does not know how to deal with the costumers. My phone was stolen at this location at nothing was done about it. Unfortunately was an Apple 4 that cost $600. I will not recommend a place.

No offense nor disrespect but I'm a Latino that's cultured around Cuban cuisines from living up North, this is the second time in 2 years that we were disappointed.  Never again!  Don't recommend, truth!

Anyone who knows Cuban food can tell the difference. The taste of the beans taste like Mexican beans. The pork chucks  ordered were saturated in oil. Any Cuban knows that pork is supposed to be accompanied with limes, which at this restaurant they do not even offered with the food, the rice was extremely dry. I am sorry, but for real Cuban food please don't waste your time. Go to Miami one day, and taste the real Cuban food.
This place is amazing. We found it on our honeymoon in 2012, and came back recently. The food was just as good and the service was excellent. The Cuban coffee is wonderful.
Just like the name, it give you a taste of Havana. Food is good and cater to American taste. The atmosphere is friendly, service is good. A good place for lunch.

I went to eat here for the first time on a Saturday night when they have the live music. On my visit, there were two men singing along with some kind of music machine with various tracks on it.  I only mention it because there werent live musical instruments being played, but it was okay because whatever sound system they have makes the music sound like it is live in the building.  They were great singers and even stepped out and danced at times with the customers who gathered at the front to dance.    

I ordered the stewed beef with rice. It was very good. I also tried the strawberry mojito.  Im not typically a drinker, but it was very strong (to me). I don't know if that's good or bad.  Otherwise our server was nice and a couple different people stopped by our table to check if we needed anything. 

Also, we had a reservation and were seated immediately.
Amazing food and service.  And good music to boot!  Get the empinadas, yucca, plantains, and tropical beef.

My wife decided to try this restaurant the other night as we are avid foodies and love trying different cuisines. We have been to other Cuban restaurants before but not with the same atmosphere and flair as Taste of Havana. After a tasty Mojito, we started out with the calamari appetizer. It was very tender and seasoned well. We both agreed the sauce was so good, you almost wanted to eat it as a soup. For entrees. she had the fried pork chunks and I had the fried shredded beef. Both were equally delicious (we tried each other's entree).
For desert, we both had the tres leches and Cuban coffee. A perfect compliment. There was also a live band which added to the ambiance. I was very pleased with the check as well. Drinks, appetizer, entrees, desert and coffee all for around $60.00 bucks including tip. We will definitely be coming back and bringing friends.

This place is GOOD! It's out in the middle of no where but well worth the drive. Everthing that we ordered was spot on.  I felt the dinner portions were small for the prices but the taste and quality of the food is well worth it.

We had a Cuban sandwich and a sampler platter. Sandwich was hard no mustard no mayonnaise no pickles.  sampler platter was very confusing. Could not tell what was what, All fried. Male Server was so not helpful. Very rude and curt.  Will not ever go back that is for sure.

NOT HAPPY. 

Service was awful.  Food came wrong. I was super disappointed.  Mojito was good though. 

Will never go back. Got the stank eye when I let them know I had issues.

My first trip here and I enjoyed it. Great restaurant and the food was amazing and authentic. Tuesday was half off wine by the glass which made my meal perfect. Friday's and Saturdays they have live music and the place is hopping. 

I gave 4/5 stars because the food was great but we were sitting at the bar and the service there was ok. Maybe the service would have been better if we had sat down at the table. But overall good experience.

Went for my b-day dinner, a little disappointed this time. They have changed the menu some, deleted some items. and this night they were out of couple of things all together. Good news they are opening a "Tapas" lounge right next door, so they will be connected. They also did some changes to the dining room - not sure if this will stay that way, but honestly wasn't overly impressed with the entire night.
We did order an app, they were out of ham croquettes, and they no longer serve calamari in the main dining room - they said they might in the Tapas lounge.
Service was good - server nice.
Want to go back for the Tapas lounge to try it out, the restaurant not sure we will eat in there anymore.
Loved the food. Great location. Family place. BUT service is hit and miss. Week day lunch took 90 minutes, and made me late for work. Coupons keep it inexpensive.

Good food!
Unfortunately...Without any disclosure they charge 24% to 21% tip included on the check.
Don't get me wrong service was good and I planned on giving a generous tip, but I'm not a fan of being tricked into tipping an amount that I did not approve of.

The food - my favorite dish, the red snapper is the best. 

My only problem is that it's difficult to get a table when you show up, yet you're told they don't take reservations. On several occasions we visited and was told there weren't any available tables because of the tables were reserved, yet there only a few people in the restaurant. I guess my question is, if you arrive at 6:30 and a table is reserved for 8:00, I don't understand why one can't be seated and served and out by the time the table is needed.
Finally made it here, and I must say DAYUM...so good! Roasted pork dish was awesome. I will be here more often

Ok...Stop into this restaurant for lunch...My husband and I love cuban food and thought we would give it a try.  Surprisingly it was very delicious..  Service was quick and steaming hot.  However, we stop in today (Sunday evening) for dinner and service was not so good...

First, for a Sunday evening (6:30p) customers were few at hand. (maybe 8)..so we had hoped service would be quick and attentive...NOT!!  On the contrary, service was very slow...
Secondly..We waited at least 30 minutes to be served. (remember almost empty restaurant)
Thirdly, and most disappointing, was the food...Unlike the lunch service, the food was luke warm....Important ingredient (Mojo sauce) left out of recipe....Rice, cold...Plantains, burned.  Smh!!  Not acceptable....
If you plan on visiting this restaurant....Make sure it's LUNCH TIME!!  Because the food is really good...

We had a party of 15 and everyone loved the food, from the crispy beef to the Cuban sandwich, from the Havana Chicken to the Cuban green beans and so much more everything was wonderful! The server was able to answer all of our questions and they took wonderful care of us. We all highly recommend it!

The food was good; however, the issue came after dinner. Our check was $59 (with a $10 tip) but our waiter ran the debit card for $82. He could not figure out how to correct the error. The manager came to the table to explain what happened. She said that the amount we filled in would be all that would run through the debit card. She lied. We had a debit from the checking account for the $59 AND the $82. When we went back to speak to the manager. She said it was up to the debit company to correct. She refused to fix it even after we demanded cash back. She said it would be applied back to the account in a month. INSANE. We would not EVER eat here again. BEWARE.

So good and the staff is so sweet! Between 4 of us we got white rice, beans and rice, and yellow rice (all delicious), fried yuca, green beans, and yummy plantains for sides!   Roasted pork, Cuban skirt steak, crispy shredded beef, and Hemingway chicken! All so good! The owner ended up giving us a gift when we left because we asked questions and complimented the food! I definitely recommend this place! Great environment as well! Clean and inviting! Next time we are in town I want to come back!

This place is to die for!!  The shredded beef is by far the best dinner entree available on the menu! they have delights like the empanadas, croquettes and much more! it's even amazing for takeout. If you stay later in the night you will enjoy the lively salsa dancers!

Was in town finding a new place to call home, and was missing my Spanish cuisine, found this place and I TOTALLY recommend it, the food was almost perfect, the service was spectacular, the place was clean and it felt good to get some authentic Cuban cuisine. If you want delicious Cuban food this place will give you your fix, and I'm from Miami I KNOW what good Cuban food is.

My husband and I came out to A Piece of Havana for dinner Saturday night. It was an A-Ok experience! Nothing bad at all but nothing spectacular. All in all, I am glad we stopped by.

We got here right around 7pm when the music was about to kick off. I was impressed because they had a decent size band playing live music!

I ordered a coconut mojito and my husband got a Dos Equis. The coconut mojito was very tasty and had shredded coconut on top. It wasn't very strong at all....not sure how much rum was in it! 

We decided to get the Havana sampler for a tizer and then split the shrimp in garlic sauce for the meal. The sampler was pretty good. However, most of the food was fried. Not really my style. I did like the plantains a lot though! The shrimp in garlic sauce was delicious though! That sauce was so yummy. For our sides we got black beans and green beans. Both were pretty decent and nice portion sizes! 

The band was awesome and definitely the highlight of the evening!

Thanks for the birthday surprise. Our first visit!  Good food, great service (by Anita & other waitstaff) wonderful atmosphere with band & nice booth so we could still carry on a conversation. 
We will definitely be back.

Recently moved to Steele Creek and found this little place. Took my mother here for her birthday lunch, and I must say I was impressed! The food was delicious, great portions, and great prices! 
A waiter noticed my daughter was eating the leftovers of some of my cake and brought me a piece for her on the house!

I definitely recommend, and we will be returning!
Always excellent food here, derive is top notch. I've been going here for 4 years. It's the best Cuban food in Charlotte hands down.
I'm cuban I love their food very authentic when my family comes over from Los angles I always take them to eat here lunch time specials are even better

Amazing restaurant, friendly staff and AWESOME food!! Good to know u can find good places to eat around Carowinds besides fast food.

Had the skirt steak with green beans and fried yuca; everything was delicious!  Tres leches cake was sooooo good!! 
Service was excellent :)

I truly recommend this place, amazing food, and affordable prices.

This is my first visit to a Cuban restaurant, but I loved A Piece of Havana.  

All of our food was absolutely delicious.  No complaints at all about the service either.  There were several large parties on the week night we were there and from what I could tell, there were only three staff members working the floor and still, our service was great.  The table beside us practically had the waiter explain the entire menu to them, plus the drink menu, and he was so patient and calm with them even though he clearly had his hands full.  I was very impressed.  

Is the food authentic?  I haven't a clue - but it was good and that's all I care about.

This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to southwest Charlotte and to A Piece of Havana. Growing up in Tampa, I have had the opportunity to eat at some authentic Cuban restaurants, but since moving to North Carolina, it has been difficult finding  Cuban food. For the most part, they fall short of my expectations.

Dora here. With so few Spanish restaurants in the Charlotte area, we were surprised to find the place empty. This is what it looked like on a Sunday around 11:30, but during our meal, people started rolling in. We just tend to be earlybirds.

For an appetizer, we chose the Caribbean Calamari, breaded, deep fried and served with a dipping sauce. The calamari was plentiful, good, fried crispy, (maybe too crispy) and worked well with the dipping sauce. Dora here. Dry and brittle for me, but hubby cleaned the plate, so...

For my meal, I chose one of my favorite Cuban specialties, Fried Pork chunks slow cooked in Mojo sauce then deep fried and topped with sautéed onions. The pork chunks were great, fried perfectly and mixed well with the Mojo sauce and sautéed onions although more mojo sauce would have been great. The plantains (banana family) were firm, just as I remembered them, and the fried yuca was cut into larger pieces than I prefer.

Dora here. After living in Tampa for so long and loving Spanish food, I admit being a little disappointed upon first glimpse of the Palomilla Steak (Bistec de Palomilla). Pounded super thin and unbreaded, I could've done without the chimichurri sauce. I don't believe it added anything and actually detracted from the presentation. What do you think? 

Still Dora. Service was quick and the place was spotless. If we make it back (it's a long drive), I will order something different to avoid comparing A Piece of Havana with all our favorite haunts in Florida. The meal ended on a high note.

We rate this restaurant 3.5 forks out of 5 for a family restaurant serving very good food. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog
I dont know i was just expecting something amazing when i was browsing through the photos and was a bit dissapointed. Food was decent.

I'm falling out of love with this place. 

Don't get me wrong--when it's good, it's really great. However....

My primary complaint is the lack of consistency, which I've heard from others also.  Each time we've come here, they're out of something--skirt steak, plantains, whatever. Sometimes they have closed before their posted closing time. Sometimes the bartender is not there during the dinner hour, which is sad, because I love their calle ocho mojitos.

I just never know what to expect.  I really hope they step up their game.

I live very close to here and decided to call in a carry out order. Ordered a Cuban sandwich which was very tasty, however I almost walked out before I got my food. It was about 630 and only about 10 people in the restaurant, I walked in and the hostess was at the front desk and gave me no attention whatsoever even when I was standing right at the desk. I remained about 10-15 minutes before the bartender finally asked me if I wanted a drink and I told him I was waiting for food, he gladly took care of me! Except for the bartender, the kind of service I received will not make me want to return any time soon. Hopefully they haven't lost too many potential customers due to this!

John B.

I just want to say this about the Restaurant...my family and I went in and there was maybe 4 people seated in the dining room and the bar was full..but plenty of open tables. We go in and say we need a table for 4...she looks at us and says we don't have any tables they are reserved. I was like really...she was like you can sit down but you have an hour to eat. What a joke...I was going to give it Another shot and call and do reservations..but they don't seem to be great with answering phones. So right off not a very good Impression of the place. Hopefully the owner fixes the reservation problem...Bc it's complete bull.

One of the worst restaurant I ever been, I went with my friends last week we were sitting at the bar trying to get a drink, no body even bother to ask us if we want some  drinks those bartenders were just looking down at never looked up we tried to get their attention but they didn't care so it took 30 minutes to get a drink, so I don't recommend that place is just  my friends and I will never go back there.

Best meal in steelcreeke! Always thinking about this place's mariquetas and Cuban coffee. If you can't stand the waits, come in on a Monday or Tuesday. Open table is also a pretty decent solution for you aren't spontaneous. There's always some type of event to look forward to in addition to the amazing food. Friday is salsa lessons!
2nd time we have been there and customer service is an issue. We waited 20 minutes after being seated we left no waitress or water even offered.

My first time coming here and it was unfortunately a bad experience. I ordered the ropa vieja with white rice and sweet plantains and a side of tostones. The meat tasted plain, the white rice was definitely not fresh(refrigerated then microwaved) and the sweet plantains was cold as if it were just sitting there for many hours. The only part of the meal i could tell was just made were the tostones. Living in Miami for the most part of my life this was definitely not the quality Cuban food Ive known and grown up to love. 

The restaurant was clean and had nice setup. The service could of been better because my waitress surely seemed as if she didn't want to be there whats so ever. She barely attended my table and was more concerned speaking to her other coworkers about God knows what but it sure wasnt about taking care of her tables. She came to my table twice which was when i ordered the food and when i asked to pay for the meal. 

Maybe today was just an off bizarre day and hope that if I come back again I can have great reviews.
Food was great but service was slow and horrible. Mojitos were eh. Ox tails were very good. Service was entirely too slow for them not to be busy.

Terrible as a previous reviews.  I really recommend not go there. First I order a Piña Colada which didn't taste like one. Terrible mixed with pieces of coconut and pretty much sugar and cheap rum. The price was $8.00 dollars really expensive for the quality. For the main plate I ordered a Mofongo which is plate very recognized in the Caribbean.  This plate look like someone throw up on the plate. From the color to the taste it was nasty plus only 2 pieces of pork hard as concrete literally.  Frozen And tasteless yuca and a old salad on the side. If you don't want to lose your appetite please don't go there. Doing business like that I don't think the will be in business for too long. Simply nasty

Skip the Paella, great atmosphere and drinks on a Friday night. Live band was great. Avocado dip was good but overpriced. Paella was wet, mushy rice with low quality imitation seafood, mixed in with shrimp, mussels, and a lobster tail on top. For $30, i expected better quality. The portion size was enormous, like family style with a serving spoon included. Picked out the shrimp and trashed the rest when i got home.
Great food, friendly servers, but SLOW and forgetful. It took over half an hour to get my check and another 10 to get it back, without my card. Definitely getting take-out next time.

We happened upon this place when the hubs was code orange, and the slow start (only one server for the whole restaurant on a Monday) left me nervous we were going to have to bail. However, once we were finally seated and our order was taken, the food was ultra fast. Our server asked if we were familiar with Cuban food, and well, I've never been there, so no. We ordered the roasted pork and grilled fish (mahi mahi). The roasted pork was good, the fish was OK but I'd order something different next time.  The plantains were (of course) delicioso, and I wished we had tried some of their really yummy looking mojitos (like 18 flavors) or sangria.  

But the whole point of this review is that FINALLY after waiting my whole life (OK so the 14 years I've been in the QC), I found worthy empanadas!! The server said the ham & cheese was his favorite but I went for the beef.  The pastry covering was nice and crispy, but not greasy at all and the beef was seasoned perfectly and also was not greasy at all!  Hallelujah!! Hail to the empanada maker!  Even though I live nowhere near Steele Creek/Ayrsley I would make an excuse to come back and have a meal of mojitos, empanadas, perhaps some of their avocado dip special and tres leches. Bueno!

Tip: coupon in Citipass made it even more reasonably priced.

Never again!!! Last time we went there we had no reservation and they kicked us out practically saying that they were booked and they had no waiting.. uhm u close @2am and it was close to 8 ish maybe when we went.. So this time we went here on Saturday night @7:20. Pm We had reservations for 5. I walked in and the hostess told me that i had called in and canceled the reservation??? She personally remembers it cause she wrote it down. I assured her that neither i nor anyone else had called and canceled it. She went next door and found us seats. Place is really nice and they have music but the service yesterday was horrible.. got appetizers after 45 min of getting our drinks. The food came in probably 45+ min later. I had to chase the waitress to bring us more drinks and she only brought us 1 of the 3 drinks we ordered... she never came back withthe other 2 drinks. I never even bothered her again about them as we were getting ready to leave anyway. The. I had to chase her for the check and a box. 20 min later i had to ask another waitress for them as my baby started to cry now!! It was way past her bedtime ( we left there @10 pm).

Food is ok. To start I was expecting Cuban bread not old sour bread. The mojo for the tostones no good. Service was nice looks clean. Pork chunks were dry. The sauce for the fried yuca was pretty good.

Warning.  I'm a highly opinionated half Cuban about my...errr....cuban food.   So unto A piece of Havana.  This is the first place (Out of Puerto Rico or Miami) that serves authentic Cuban food.    Want to know if you're in a real Cuban Restaurant?  Ask for a Materva.  If they don't have any, calmly proceed to the door.  Guess what, A  Piece of Havana keeps them ice cold.

Friday night is great here.  The Jazz band plays great Latin music, and creates a great ambiance.

The food:  My favorites are the Ropa Vieja, and the Parrillada Cubana will give you a a huge selection of food (steak, pork, and chicken), plus rice beans and sweet plantains.  

Next time I go there, I plan to order the Sea Food Paella.  It looked insane.  

I would eat here every week if it was closer to my house.

Have I said enough?  Go get your Cuban on!

There are very few Cuban restaurants in Charlotte.  So, I give this one a four partially out of scarcity.

If you live in South Charlotte, definitely go.  It's a hearty, flavorful meal.

I don't know if I would make a trip out of it from huntersville, let's say, unless you just really want Cuban food.

In all, I thoroughly enjoyed it, however.

I was very disappointed with my meal. I ordered the pork platter and it was so bland, this is not authentic cuban food. Me and my husband spent $30 for horrible food what a waste our hard earned money. I will never go there back again

Friday nights have live music, appears to start at 7pm, we (5 adults) arrived without a reservation at 6pm and were seated immediately but many others had reservations for 7 or later. Call ahead! 
Shared the fried plantain appetizer, DELICIOUS, and everyone liked their dishes- pork, chicken, pasta, shrimp. Friend with gluten allergies loves to eat here! She says it's never crowded at lunchtime. Green beans, fried yuca and sweet plantains are some of our favorite side options; haven't tried the sandwiches but willing to go back!

Visiting Charlotte for a week, and happened to pass by this place on a Friday night- the live music was intoxicating and my friend and I had to check it out. Food was good... atmosphere was great... and the musicians were playing passionately  add my 2 glasses of Tempranillo and it was beyond lovely. Only thing I wish was that they had more tables available. It was a bit strange to see all the tables in the center of the restaurant completely empty on a Friday night- and to have to leave earlier than we would have liked due to a reservation coming in. (We were still super grateful they sat us for the hour and a half we had there though.)  Really fun dinner experience, will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could. 

Normally I love going here. I think they're food is excellent! I get the shrimp in garlic sauce with Cuban toast and green beans. The meal was swimming in garlic. Almost literally. I didn't finish because it was so garlicky. Pretty sure I am going to smell like garlic tomorrow. However, I do love some garlic, so this will not deter me from coming back. 

I also got the house made sangria. It is $3 on Monday which I think is a good deal. For all of you beer lovers a pint of Coors light is $2 everyday. Back to the sangria, it was ok. Vey sweet, but a good compliment to the meal. 

I thought our service was great. If I could just rate our waiter I would give him a 5 out of 5 stars. Very attentive and helpful with making our decisions.

I've tried this place twice and both times the service was lousy along with the food. I love Cuban food... The first time I ordered the whole fried fish and it was over cooked and tasted as though it had been cooked in old oil, my plantains were over cooked as well.  my girlfriend ordered some dish that contained shrimp that weren't  de-veined.. The only reason I gave it a second chance was because  she loves their mojito's.. This last time I ordered Pollo a la Habanera, rice and beans, and plantains. The chicken was over cooked and lacked any seasoning at all.  She ordered Ropa Vieja.  It did not taste or look like it has other places.  She pushed her plate to the edge of the table and our server (Manuel) asked what was wrong.  She proceeded to explain that it did not taste as expected. He responded that it was their signature dish, then proceeded to ask what was wrong with it in a harsh tone.  I interjected and stated that it was different from what she had before and maybe the recipes were different.. He snatched the plate away and did not return for 40 mins.  

The overall service was terrible.. We had to grab another member of the wait staff in order to get another drink, another member of the staff refilled her water, and I was never offered anymore tea by my server.  I kept my cool no need to get upset it wasn't worth it.. 

In conclusion.. I've had two bad experiences at this establishment and I love Cuban food.. I love food period. In order to get me to write a negative post you've really had to screw up..

The bright spot of the night was the entertainment though.. Loved the band.. They made the atmosphere very fun and pleasant.. 

 If you're ever in the DMV you should look up Cuba De Ayers..

I've been here a couple of times for lunch, right before the holidays and again after.  Both times the service was a little spotty.  We would get seated right away but then it would take awhile for our order to be taken.  Once we ordered the food came out pretty quickly but then it would take awhile to get drink refills.  By the time we got refills we were ready for our checks which also took awhile to get.  Aside from that the food was pretty good.  I had the ropa vieja the first time which was good but didn't come with enough rice (at least for me, I like to have some rice for each bite and I ran out half way into my meal!)  I had to ask for more, which they had no problem just giving me some more.  The second time I went I tried the lechon asado which was also good.  This time I ordered the rice which had the black beans mixed in and that was a better helping than when I ordered the rice with the beans on the side...I'll definitely be back for lunch to try some of their other dishes but hopefully they can get their service a little faster.  They are very nice and helpful but just a little on the slow side!

The live band can start at any time even though the website says after 10pm.  On the Saturday we went it started at 7pm.  

I personally hate loud music while I'm eating and they had a microphone on every instrument.  In a small space like their dining room you don't need to be that mic'd up.  I was deaf before we got our food and we couldn't carry a conversation with our friends.  

A good band knows how to adjust their volume for the venue.  They played a weird mix of Latin and US pop songs, and Bob Marley.  I wouldn't go back just for their band unless they lowered the volume and stuck to a theme in their music.  It's not a drunk wedding crowd they're playing for...

I got the Cuban sandwich (no cheese) with fries.  It was pretty tasty but I was burping pork the following 24 hours.  We went out afterwards and I definitely did not feel like dancing!  I would go back to try another dish but only if that's the only thing we're doing all night...

Great restaurant...I read some great reviews on Yelp and knew I had to try this place. I was impressed with the service and the food was perfect. They also have live music and a nice little dance floor to get your salsa on. Great place you won't be disappointed!

I really tried to give this place a chance several times because I am of Cuban heritage and grew up to enjoy Cuban food. Each time I went with my mother who speaks fluent Spanish was great, but when I have gone by myself it was a whole different experience since I do not speak Spanish. 

The first time, the service was so bad. The hostess had an attitude with us and told us we had half an hour to eat. Our waitress came to our table only twice. We ended up having to speak with a manager and she gave us a $15 voucher for the next time we came in. 

So the next AND LAST time we came in we tried making a reservation for 8:30 and the man who picked up the phone kept telling us that they closed at 9. I told him we understood that but we were driving 2 and a half hours to eat at that particular restaurant. He then told us basically that by the time we got there we could not eat within 20 minutes. We got there anyway at 8:30 and were able to finish our meals by 9 no problem. Pretty sure the same man served our table. 

We ordered the croquette and empanada platter. When it finally came out we received 5 empanadas and no croquettes. We were only informed then that there were no croquettes and we got 1 extra empanada. This did not seem fair because we were still charged the $9 for an uneven number of empanadas when there were two of us and we were supposed to get a total of 4 empanada and 4 croquettes. He then asked us how many empanada we would rather have and if he should take the extra one away. He almost grabbed the 5th empanada with his hand. 

Our next peeve was that we specifically asked for the salted plantains instead of the sweet ones as our side and we got the sweet ones instead. He then told us that since we said plantain instead of tostone, we got the sweet ones. Right after that I saw him go up to another coworker with an attitude and point at our table. 

Overall we will not be returning again and will take our business somewhere else. Being open until 9 does not mean you stop serving half an hour before and that you have a limited time to eat. I have worked in the restaurant business and if you cannot wait for customers to finish eating after the time you close then you should not be working there. Being tipped is based on the quality of service that is deserved. It's very poor management and extremely rude. It is such a shame.

One of my favorite lunch spots. Great prices and fresh, delicious Cuban food. The crispy beef, tostanas, and congris are my favorite - but everything is pretty great.

Only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is that the service is always very slow. The waiters are nice but it just takes forever to get orders in and pay. Would be nice to be able to get in and out in 30 mins but you'll need an hour here at least.

Ordered Mariquitas and got something that was not
Even close to what we ordered. And we questioned the waiter she said yes I know but this is what they did.  Service could not have been worse. Croquetas left a lot to be desired.  Enjoyed the live music but other than that will never be back!!!

If you are looking for a super-quick, super-affordable lunch and find yourself in this area, A Piece of Havana may be worth a try.  I ordered the roasted chicken with mixed rice/black beans and plantains.  I think the dish was $5.95 which is a great price.

However, I was a bit disappointed in the chicken - it was tasty but a rather small portion. Sadly, the mixed beans& rice was a bit dry and did not have a lot of flavor.  The plantains were good though.  

On the plus side, the service was very good and the food was delivered  super-quick. 

This place is not bad overall and if I happened to be in the area I would probably give them another try.

The food here was wonderful. My date and I had mojitos for drinks that were fresh and delicious. I ordered the chicken and he ordered the Cuban sandwich and we both shared the appetizers. the waitress provided great service. I will definitely be back.

Food is ok, service is not that great. Nothing that really makes me feel like I'd want to come back. Empanadas were good that's about it. If you want to have Cuban you can try it, I'm sure there's better places though.

FInally had a chance to check out this place. I'm a large proponent of Cuban cuisine and had put off trying this place for far too long. It's a trek from where we live in Dilworth, but I'd say it's damn worth it. Located off of South Tryon past Carowinds, It's in a small shopping center, but as it's own building. 

We stopped in on a Saturday night and we were greeted with live music. It was awesome. The guy was singing his heart out and I'm happy to say that he was really good. It wasn't unpleasant at all. Actually added to the ambiance.

We started out with the avocado dip (basically guac) with fried plantains. Dude. I'd highly recommend getting this. The dip is pretty commonplace with other guac varieties, but the fried plantains make for a really nice change-up from plain corn chips. We cleaned the plate between the three of us. 

I went with the Cuban sandwich. I have to order it any time it's offered at a Cuban place. Happy to report it's a textbook sandwich. Flaky Cuban bread, yellow mustard, Swiss, pork, ham, dill pickles. That's all you need. Ordered it with a side of tostones. Mashed, and fried plantains served with "mojo." Basically an oily, garlic-y dipping sauce. It's amazing. Super mild and a nice touch.

We also ordered a couple of the gin mojitos. Have to give these a big "meh." It's a great idea, but the grenadine really killed the flavors. It was just too heavy.

Service was incredibly friendly and cordial. The place was packed and the guys on the floor took care of everyone with a smile. 

Cuban dinner round #2: Coming very soon.
I ordered the oxtails with rice, beans, and plantains. By far, the best oxtails I've had. Absolutely delicious.
Had lunch here and it was excellent. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and not drowned in salt. Croquetas are made fresh to order. The red bean soup was so delicious. I will definitely be coming back!

I have to admit the first time I went here the service we had was a 2 star performance.  It would have been a 1 star if we didn't start asking other servers for things (turned out our original server couldn't care less).   Having said that, the food was what brought me back - never had fried yucca before!

The second visit was a complete 180!  Our server was super-attentive and kept the cups full and checked up on us consistently and always with a smile.  The food was again amazing - I could seriously eat their chimichurri sauce out of a bowl.  This time there was a live musician and the atmosphere was electric - people got up to dance in the front as well!  The coolest thing I noticed was that most of the tables were larger groups - which probably aided in the festive atmosphere.

You'd be a fool to not try their fried yucca and if you're really going for that food coma- definitely get the tres leches for dessert!!
Was there Friday night for drinks. Atmosphere is great!!!  So was the music!!  Def a nice spot to go with friends or a date.

Came here for lunch and it was around half capacity. Appetizer sampler platter was great and came out quick, but I agree with the other reviews that the service for entrees was a little on the slow side. Would not recommend coming here if you need a quick 30 minute in and out. 

I had the Ropa Vieja and it was pretty good, but a little salty. It comes default with white rice, black beans, and plaintains, but you can sub them for 2 sides of your choice. Papaya shake was great and recommended. I'd probably go back, but it won't be a staple favorite.

I consider myself Cuban by default... I was born and raised in Miami and just left two years ago. That said, I was so excited when discovering this home away from home! I have to admit I was skeptical at first but they had me at my first mojito! 

The food is muy rica (delicious) and very on point with what Cuban food is. We started with the mariquitas (thin slices of crispy plantains) and they transported me to calle Ocho in little Havana!  I ordered my favorite dish- vaca frita and it did not disappoint. We ended with flan and tres leches for dessert. Since then we have gone back several times and had great experiences. Never a bad dish.

They have live music on the weekend (first was a great salsa band.. Another time was just a Latin dude and his keyboard). 

Either way I am a fan and when I'm craving some good old Cuban cooking, that is where I head!
Delicious food with a colorful and festive environment. The crispy beef is amazing and their yuca (both fried and boiled) is the perfect side. An authentic and affordable meal with friendly staff.

I give the food a 4 star, but the service was pretty bad.  We had to remind the waiter 3 times to bring our drink and he told us the wrong information on a few of the dishes we ordered.  I will definitely go back, just with lower expectations on the service.

This is the first time eating here. It's a friends birthday dinner and everyone is pretty disappointed with their meals! The steaks were way over cooked. My side- green beans and fried Ukas taste freezer burned. Drinks and atmosphere is all this place has going for it!

I love this place. It's a warm, family-owned and family oriented restaurant, plus the food is always amazing! My fiancée and I usually share the paella dish, which has lots of seafood and flavorful saffron rice. You can't go wrong with the mojitos, especially the Calle Ocho! The servers are friendly, the atmosphere is vibrant. I'd definitely recommend it, wether you're just in the mood for lunch or dancing the night away, you'll have a great time at A Piece of Havana!

Stopped by here for lunch. It's a good size restaurant with a nice little bar. Menu seems authentic with the little knowledge I have on Cuban food. But naturally I had to order the Cuban sandwich and the mariquitas with avocado. The sandwich was good but the mariquitas were the best I've had while warm.

My go to for Cuban food for lunch. I passed this place dozens of times before me and my fiancée finally decided to try it, and we were not disappointed! Their lunch prices are really low for the amount of food you get. But let's get into the important stuff, the food. I can only speak for the beef and chicken dishes but both are amazing! Flavorful and moist. You can't go wrong. For sides, I usually get the beans and rice and plantain and both are always made well. I have been several times and the food is always consistent and fresh. For $6 you can get a quality meal the same price as fast food. You can't beat it.

Got some coffee and plaintains to go while on a road trip. The coffee was great. Good flavor and hot. The plaintains were not good. I have had much better other places. Next time a road trip brings me this way, I will stop and try the full menu before I write their food off.

This is authentic Cuban! We were thrilled to find this place. The tastes took us right back to our childhood kitchen in Miami where our abuela cooked. 
The croquetas came out piping hot. The to stones were great. I had the masitas de puerco and they were great too. I asked for lime just because that was how we ate them growing up, with lots of lime. The boiled yuca was good, could have used a bit more mojo. My kids had a pan con bistec. It was the thin steak cooked just as it should, i am just not sure it was on real cuban bread. It comes with mayo and mustard so we opted to have it without. They ate it all though and really liked it. The Cuban coffee (espresso) was very authentic, the way they make it on calle ocho. We look forward to returning. So glad to find this place!

Authentic cuban. Good sandwiches and pork dishes. Food should have been much hotter as it was room temp. Flavor was on point. Service was slow but friendly. Very rude hostess told us we couldn't stay ( there was about 8 or 9 empty tables too ) and that was super annoying as we spent a lot of money and even ordered food to take home. Live music was terrific.

Very good food! I lived in Miami for17 years and was spot on for variety of dishes, etc.
Finally found a good Latin restaurant in the Charlotte area!
Updating because return visits have proven to be a much better experience. Although, I have not tried another Cuban sandwich. I chose more traditional Cuban entrees and enjoy them very much.

I will never go to this place again!!! My family and I have tried to come here...key word TRIED several times n they are always closed or just closed hours before the time indicated online. They claim they are a family owned business n when business is dead they close early so there for they need to indicate that online.... Needless to say that will be my 3rd n last time trying to eat at this family owned business... Good luck running business like that!

Worst Cuban food I've have ever had. Beans had a funky taste (maybe burned). Ropa Vieja was dry, clumpy & so bad tasting I couldn't eat it (and I have never not eaten a meal at a restaurant before). Also, I ordered the smaller portions and brought/charged for the more expensive portions. Same situation with my wife who ordered the steak which had a good sauce on it but the steak itself was practically tasteless. My kids ordered Cuban Sandwiches & Miami Sandwiches but the waitress came back to tell us that they had none. No Cuban Sandwiches at a Cuban restaurant? That should have been my warning sign. When the bill came, we were charged for 3 extra items and a hefty tip was already included. We informed her of the incorrect bill and she corrected it but left the same tip for the higher amount. Basically she gave herself a 28% tip! I corrected the tip but because I know how hard these people have to work for a living I still gave her a 20% tip. Waitress was nice and apologetic but service was mediocre at best. I know there are not many Cuban restaurants in the greater Charlotte area but still would drive past this one to get to another one much further away. I have never said this before but if you're thinking of going here, think twice about it. Honestly, I felt like it was a waste of money.

I will start out by saying my husband and I eat out quite a bit so we are seasoned restauranteurs. 

My husband and I tried this restaurant previously and were not impressed with the service. The food at that time  was good but very slow service. We thought that maybe the busyness of Mother's Day had contributed to the slow service. Well after our most recent visit, it is quite apparent that they just give slow service. Most restaurants give bread that you can munch on while your food is being prepped but not this one. You have to order it like an appetizer to get any. The food is standard but not exceptional. Our reason for going to a restaurant is to eat and not to socialize. For others gathering here as a group function with no rush to get done with their meals, this place would probably be fine. Couldn't help but wonder how the lunch crowd get serviced during the week when their lunch time is limited... Not sure if we'll be back. There are other restaurants that consider the needs of their customers that we'll revisit before Havana.

I love the food here but like a lot of really good places in this area, it can get slow during lunch.  I've also heard they can get really busy at dinner time but I've only had lunch. Try the crispy shredded beef or the milanesa steak.

sadly, meat (Vaca Frita) was greasy, fries were really sad looking, plantains were ok.  service pleasant but not very good.  I read the reviews but someone else picked the place calling it "hit or miss."  Our visit wasn't terrible but I certainly won't be wasting my calories there again.

I don't know what your other options for decent cuban food in the area are, but I would recommend you look somewhere else.

I went with a large group to A Piece of Havana and over all had a good experience. I was born in Miami, FL so I am use to Cuban culture and food. Had some croquettas for an appetizer they were ok not quite how I remembered them but not bad. For an entree I had the Havana pork which was much better than the appetizer. My wife had the Milanesa Steak and it was also good. A WARNING this is a Cuban restaurant and is going to have a laid back atmosphere. You will most likely not get in and out quickly. If you want to talk and have a few drinks this is a good place to do it while having decent Cuban food. But if you want a quick meal I would not recommend it. I gave 3 stars becuase although the food was decent I never felt the need to go back again.

A really nice restaurant with great Cuban food...try the beef empanadas!  Service was friendly, but a bit slow.  Drinks were well-made - especially mojitos.  Would certainly recommend a trip to this place...and we look forward to our next visit!

If I could give zero stars I would!!! Service was absolutely terrible!! Went here yesterday with a friend we both order something different. She order shrimp scampi and I ordered Cajun shrimp. My dish was soooo salty, I could barely eat it! It was terrible and my friends pasta was drenched in oil, just disgusting. We ask to speak with a manager and was told thirty minutes of waiting that she wasn't in the building. Needless to say I was very dissatisfied

Very good restaurant. Not in love but it's good Cuban food. Ox tail was pretty good. I've definitely had better. Their chicken chunks however were really good. It is a citrus alternative to Mexican. I'll be back.

So I have been here multiple times and I would have given it a much higher review had I not had the experience I had last night. I suggested to a few girl friends that we have a Monday night girls night for Sangrias and dinner. I have been here before and the food is always good and the mojitos were always good so seemed like a winner. Well that's where I was apparently wrong. 

Our waitress had to be the nicest WORST waitress in the history of the profession. Two of us got there at 5:30 and were seated at a table. We decided we'd like to move to a booth so we were waiting for the waitress to come back. This is where the night of waiting begins. We didn't get out of this restaurant until about 8:45 when it was all said and done. Every time she'd come by and say oh I'll be right back it became a minimum 30 minute wait. Took us over an hour to get our food not to mention the hour it took us just to get to order the food. The Sangrias were really bad. Tasted like concentrated juice (without added water) and really sweet off red wine. The empanadas were tasty and my friends chicken soup looked and smelled amazing. Our main courses came out not as hot as they should have considering the wait and one of the orders came out wrong. 3 of us ordered the crispy beef and somehow my friend got a different beef dish instead. I got a mojito after the bad sangria which I again didn't drink because the basil was discolored and slimy and it was really watered down. I have never had a bad drink here before so I'm not sure why it was this bad but something changed.

 Now as I was watching I gather they only had 2 people working the floor and the bar last night so they were short staffed. I was prepared to just say okay they are having a bad day. We order dessert, she's picked up the pace here at the end, and the bar has shut down so pretty sure they wanted to close up shop. She brings us our bills and we notice that gratuity has been included already. Also it's a hefty gratuity (over 20%). For my one friend that was the last straw for her and she asked to speak to the manager. We asked if it was customary to add gratuity to a group of 4. He says yes this is what we do here. Then another friend asks but it says we are a table of 6 not 4 on our bills. So then he back tracks and says oh no she put it in wrong etc. (I feel here there is a language issue going on and want to give the benefit of the doubt but I probably shouldn't). The whole thing was a mess. We had an enjoyable night in spite of the bad service but that was due to good company. The food was good but definitely not as hot as it should have been considering how long we waited. 

Overall I'm giving it 3 stars because I've been here before and the food, drinks, and service were good. However If I was basing it on last nights visit I definitely would give it 1 star. Also my tres leches cake was not very good... tasted like grocery store cake where the bottom had been soaked in condensed milk. This could be skewed because I've had amazing tres leches cake in Charlotte and this didn't live up to it.

Great food and fantastic atmosphere.  The tiramisu is a must.  Service is a little slow for lunch, but it is part of the culture.  Never been here for dinner but the lot has had cars in it when I've driven by.

The ropa vieja and lechon asada are my favorites

Wonderful food! Love everything I've ever ordered there. I also love the mojitos, they have several flavors and all are homemade, no pre-mixed crap, always a plus! The service is typically very attentive. The atmosphere is nice and would be a great date spot.
Based on the reviews this was a must try while visiting Charlotte. Had the Cuban with sweet plantains the bread was a bit hard but over not to bad.

Simply an excellent place for Cuban cuisine! All the food was flavorful and tasty. Only complaint is that the service is SLOW! I know it's crowded, but to me, that means you need better planning to stay in this business.

But, the food was worth the wait. Just be prepared to tough it out, especially during the weekends.

I promise I wanted to like this place. I moved here from New York and my family is of Cuban descent so I was excited. To see this place...until I tried the food. The sandwiches are DRY. the pork is DRY and unseasoned. All of the food lacked seasoning and the empanadas were more grease than anything. It was very disappointing. I guess for people who don't know what the food is supposed to taste like then this is a great place but I will NEVER eat here again. I literally feel sick and like I'm gonna vomit.

It's rare I come across a place that gets everything right. There's almost always something I'd do differently if I owned the business. But A Piece of Havana is the sort of place where I'd really have to be stretching to find any reasonable criticism.

In the 10-15 times I've been here I've tried several different appetizers, entrees, desserts and cocktails and not once has anything failed to impress. As far as I'm concerned, there are really only a few things a Cuban place has to get right: Cuban sandwich, mojito, ropa vieja, flan and cortadito. And finally, some effort has to be made with the decor and music to make the diner forget for a moment that he/she is actually still in Charlotte, NC. 

In every one of these and many more, A Piece of Havana surpasses expectation. Something as simple as their black beans are the best black beans I've ever had. The flan is also the best I've had, at least outside of the Spanish speaking world. 

Perhaps most impressive, the Cuban sandwich is as good as you're going to get outside of south Florida. I grew up taking family vacations to the Tampa Bay area to visit family. And until I found this place I'd given up on finding a proper Cuban sandwich in Charlotte. I don't know where they get their bread or if they bake it themselves, but it makes the sandwich. Everywhere else, to their eternal shame, seems to substitute French bread.

As with the rest of the reviews, this place is true authentic Cuban cuisine. The food is fresh and loaded with flavor and the portions are average size. Black beans, Cuban Style Ground Beef with rice, Mariquitas with Avocado Dip , and Cuban toast were just a few of the items we really enjoyed. They had live music on the night we were there which was a Friday. If you are looking for a quick meal this is not the place as we were there about 1.5 hours from start to finish. Although a little pricy, you get what you pay for. Will def. be back again.

Love it, love it, love it! Vaca Frita is incredible. Ropa vieja amazing. Wines are priced fair. Service was great (Betty) - she came by multiple times to check on us. Food was brought out promptly. She also told us that they have live music and turn into a club at night. We lived in Miami before and always look for great Cuban places ... This one will be on the "Charlotte rotation".
Hands down the best Cuban place in town! Their Havana chicken and friend plantains are amazing as are their Cuban sandwiches and sides.
55 minutes and our appetizers are still no where to be seen. The excuse of, "we are busy" is not acceptable to paying customers. Going to be busy, staff appropriately

A Piece of Havana is the kind of restaurant you'd drive past a thousand times and never think to stop.  Then, one day you do and you never stop coming back.  

Located in the way back of a shopping center, you think it's going to be some shlubby fast food dive (not the good kind).  It isn't.  The inside of the restaurant is almost opulent with deep leather booths and romantic curtains over massive windows.  

And then there's the food.  I had the empanadas, Cuban sandwich and my boyfriend had the roasted chicken.  All were outstanding!  In addition, my boyfriend had the Cuban salad.  It had at least an entire avocado sliced along the rim.  It was delicious.  I'm so glad we went and we will keep going back.  Next time, I'm getting the oxtail.

We had a great experience here tonight. We ordered Cuban sampler appetizers, which were very tasty, although some weren't as warm as I'd prefer. The mojitos were fantastic (definitely try the coconut). For dinner, we had the Parrillada Cubana which had pork, Havana chicken, and steak. It was great and I really liked the rice which had a lot of flavor and definitely added a lot to the meal. Our server did a great job pacing the meal for us and she was quite attentive, in spite of what some other reviews have stated. Definitely recommend folks in the area try this place out!
Good food. Great value. Unbelievable tamales,coconut flan, and my hubby loves the Calle Ochos!
beautiful place, good food good atmosphere, I like, a excellent care what a great time with my family I recommend for its authentic Cuban food

Went in for its weekend salsa band and DJ. Had a great time. Bartenders made you feel right at home and were respectful. You've got to try their empanadas. Customers were filled with regulars and friendly with out of towners. Music was awesome!

The restaurant is decorated quite nicely, though the silverware wrapped in paper napkins took away from the custom made leather chairs. There was a guitar player doing the usual Spanish guitar numbers. There were eight tables seated and two waiters, which may explain why it took 20 minutes to take my order. My waiter was nice and attentive once he came over. Two of the eight tables were speaking Spanish, which could be a good sign that ethnic locals frequent this place.

I had the Original Mojito, Cuban Salad, Pork Chunks with Congri and Plantains. The mojitos here are all made from scratch. My mojito was made right away and was very good. The Cuban Salad came out in about five minutes, and the meal came out a few minutes later. The salad was just as it appears in pictures posted to Yelp. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. The pork chunks were properly marinated and cooked, and were really good. The congri and the plantains were as I expected, which is to say good and authentic.

I ordered the Tres Leches for dessert. While it was ok, it certainly was not authentic. Instead of the real thing, this was a slice of pound cake soaked in condensed/evaporated milk with whipped cream topping covered with a squirt of dulce de leche.

Overall, the food and drinks were great, dessert was ok, and service was ok.

Mostly everything we ordered was good however the cubano sandwich and the fried whole snapper, (4) ordered at our table, not so much. The fish was terribly overcooked and underseasoned and the sandwich was just awful. The bread was hard, meat was cold...it's just wasn't good. The other plates ordered like the seafood salad and ropa vieja were scrumptious! Drinks were good and the service delightful.

Right away I liked the look and "feel" of this place.  They were busy for lunch today (a Wednesday) mostly men in white dress shirts and ties filling tables for four.  This place has some character, is comfortable and is a lot nicer looking than I was expecting.

I ask one of the waiters about Cuban Style Espresso and told me to try something else.  I do not speak much Spanish so I have no idea what it was, though the name sounded really good and he seemed confident that I would like it.  Since I believe "Fortune favors the Bold" I thought I would see how I liked it.  This Coffee with milk had a good (not great) flavor and it was better than many, though miles from the Great Cuban Style Espresso I'm used to!  What he described as their approach to Espresso Cuban Style sounded close (close but not quite) and I probably should have ordered it and will next time.  OK I know I'm crazy and I do not speak Coffee, so I'm part to blame!

They serve their Cuban Sandwich with Mayonnaise, yet you can choose to have it with none as I did!  This Cuban Sandwich was very good, the pickles were thick, the mustard could have had a less dominant presence though I'm not counting that against it!  Swiss Cheese, Ham and Pulled Pork, YUM!  This sandwich gets 3.85 yelp stars, because I am almost a fan. 

Instead of Fried Potatoes (french Fries) I substituted ($.99) fried Plantains (the sweet kind).  The Plantains were perfect...5 yelp stars!

Soup of the day was Corn (Not the Creamy style) I guess it was a broth or water base, was flavored nicely and had some meat in it, 3 yelp stars.

The service was Superboy on Cuban and if you do not know that is a compliment.  They made one small mistake on my order yet fixed it before it left the kitchen and I know they don't think I saw it.  They put fries on the plate and my server caught it before he picked up the plate to bring it to me.  Five Stars for Service!

Hidden gem in Charlotte. Ordered the combo plate and everything was delicious! Chimchurri sauce fresh and delicious. Great monitors. 
Friendly service and good atmosphere!

The kids menu was pre cooked and just heated, the beef was dry. My order was cold and my wife's order beef was raw. Prices are expensive for the food they serve. The ecuadorian waitress was very good, she did everything possible for us to enjoy the food but good service does not solve a bad meal.

Recently moved to Charlotte and heard about A Piece Of Havana from some co workers so of course I had to try it. The best days to go if you're into entertainment while you dine are Fridays and Saturdays. On these nights, a live salsa band performs salsa versions of greatest hits. I would recommend making a reservation as it can get extremely crowded on these nights. The waiters are all very friendly. The drinks are good and well priced. The spotlight here is the food. The empanada platter is very good (it comes with 4 empanadas and 4 croquettes. I usually get the Crispy beef which is delicious with the chimichurri sauce on top. The churrasco is also very good. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for cuban food in Charlotte.

This is going to be one of my new stops when I hit Charlotte. Great food, great service. Lunch prices are very appealing. Entrees come with two sides. Extra sides are very reasonably priced. Had the Havana Chicken, mixed beans/rice, and plantains.  I appreciated that even as a solo diner I didn't feel rushed out during business hour; the place is big enough that the staff isn't rushing to turn over tables. Recommend.

This is a cute little place, authentic Cuban food, first time I went there,  food was delicious  I had the rice with black beans and pulled pork with a side of plantain. Taste great, but then every time I order something they prepare it different from the first time. I know they cannot be changing chef that fast. I also love the Yuca,  but with the constant changes I cannot take it anymore.

The place is nice. I had "Vaca Frita" it was OK but it tasted more like "chimichuri" than Vaca Frita. They have traditional Cuban sodas like they have back in my home town of Miami. But being from Miami I am spoiled when it comes to Cuban food and am very selective. The "mariquitas" (fried plantain chips) were a bit soggy and had too much salt on them. The server was nice but it seemed like it was a Cuban restaurant trying to give the appearance of a Mexican one to gain money from "anglo locals" that assume anything "Latin" = Mexican. I would go back on Friday Nights when there is a salsa and the Cuban community really comes out.  Overall I liked it.

Not bad, but it could have been a lot better. To be fair even in Miami it's not easy finding really GOOD Cuban cuisine these days.

The Ajiaco soup didn't have any pumpkin or chunks of meat, it was very bland. The roast pork was OK but needed lots more mojito and more onions. The masas de puerco (fried pork chunks) were cut into too small pieces, they were fried right but the chef failed to use any garlic which is a must for that dish. This restaurant doesn't even offer chicharrones de pollo which is like the best fried chicken in the world and the so called "Cuban turnover" was an Argentine empanada. 

The sides were solid, the congri (rice and black beans) was not typical but way better than usual, the maduros (sweet plantains) delish and the tostones tasted like.... tostones. 

Prices were very reasonable, portions were generous, service was cheerful and you better drink tons of water before bed to compensate for all that salt. 

There's potential but the chef needs to get a lot bolder with his spice rack, mojito and garlic.

Any Cuban Latin jazzy music fans in the house? If so, I strongly recommend a Friday night visit to a Piece Of Havana. Found within which warm friendly atmosphere, extraordinary service, and drinks that will have you ready to get up and try your steps.
Initially thought of being good and simply ordering a caesar salad, but the lure of oxtails won me over, and oh, was I happy that I made them change. Their oxtails were tender, extraordinarily seasoned, and pleasing to the palate..
A taste of the empanadas also proved to be a wise choice, especially the beef. The washing is down with the cool crisp mojito, I was ready to try my Latin two step on the dance floor with everyone else...
Come on down on Friday night and get your tastebuds pleased and your dance step on at a Piece Of Havana.

Definitely a disappointment!  I had high hopes but all quickly went downhill when our waiter informed us that most of the ingredients needed for their menu selections were unavailable due to Hurricane Irma - seriously!  Responsible owners should know when to keep their doors closed.  Management made no apologies to customers.   Es Una Pena.

You want legit Cuban food? Come here. - from a cuban
It might take some time to seat you but the food it worth the wait. Abuela's home cooking in Charlotte. Will definitely come back!

A nice change of pace.  Started with the Havana Sampler which included foods made with corn, plantain, pork, and ham.  All of it very enjoyable. For dinner we split the dinner for two . The pork was incredible and the steak we full of flavor.  Cuban coffee and tres leches for desert were also very pleasing .
