While the cafe con leche and cafe cubano were great, the tostones and croquettes were extremely bland.  The tostones were like eating cardboard, very little seasoning.  Hell, a little salt would have made them better.  Prices were very good.  We got 2 cafe con leches, 1 cafe cubano, order of tostones, and an order of croquettes for $13.

I was very excited to try this place out. We drove over an hour on Friday night. We were told we had to wait 50 minutes to be seated. We waited outside because it was so crowded inside and loud.
Way too loud...not very family friendly. It's more like a nightclub setting not really for intimate dinner or quiet family time.
Very bad service. Bar was rowdy and they had three large parties going on at the same time. We tried to get a drink at the bar, but bartender never acknowledged us. We scrambled to get a menu while we waited but hostess was too busy and snotty.
Reservations are required or a must.
I will not be coming back here.
Ended up at another latin- family friendly restaurant for the evening. We spent over $100.00.
Food was fabulous. Service was ok, server seemed nice just rushed us because she said the were closing in 20 minutes.  It was only 8:30. Prices are fair I suggest the churrasco steak

I went here last night with a few friends before we went over to Cajun Canvas.  The atmosphere is nice and festive.  The chairs are all leather, but sit very low.  Our server was friendly, but probably could have checked on us more.  We went for dinner around 5:30 or so and it was pretty empty. 

I ordered the Havana Fantasy drink - and boy, do you get your money's worth!  That drink was strong!  It was very good - and it was $8 - so honestly, I was glad that I could taste the liquor I paid for.  I felt like this place was ok, and fine.  Then our food came...

I ordered the shrimp in garlic sauce with Cuban toast and fried yuca.  That's the moment I became a total Piece of Havana fan.  The food was delicious!  The sauce and shrimp dish was just right, the bread was great, and the yuca was crispy and amazing.  Maybe it was the strength of my drink that made my dinner taste so good, but I will definitely be back.  Everything was reasonably priced too, for a nice dinner out.

I hate that I didn't have a better experience because I was really looking forward to eating here. 

We made a reservation and ventured out on a Wednesday night.We were promptly greeted and seated in a booth... and then no one ever came back. We waited and waited and waited. We finally waited so long that I got up and went to the bar because that was the only place I could see any of the staff. I told a waitress we'd been sitting for 15 minutes with no server, and she said she didn't know who ours was, but she'd find out. Apparently our waiter was also the bartender. He was really nice, but trying to find him at any point during our meal was like trying to find a needle in a haystack (until it was time to pay and then he was Johnny on the spot.)

Our food was good - we got beef/ham and cheese empanadas to start, and then I got the Havana Pork with plantains and boiled yucca, and the fella got the Fried Pork with rice and green beans - but our service was so terrible that it colored our whole experience.

To end on a positive note, they did have live music, which was a nice touch and not too overpowering.

I've never been to a Cuban restaurant before today. Having been exposed to Cuban culture through my wife's family, I have only tasted some homemade Cuban food. 
My wife and I ate pork and beef empanadas to start with. Pork is the best. We then ordered skirt steak / black beans and rice and the cubed pork /black beans and rice. We were totally impressed with the food.
The service was excellent and the waiter patiently explained what we didn't know about the food we were ordering. I finished with Cuban coffee. I never tasted Cuban coffee before. I had two cups! The only negative was the iced tea. It was very weak and I could have read a newspaper through it.
Totally great experience ! We will be back !

Visited this location while in town on vacation! and wow! this place is lively and jumping on a Friday night.  I think it was because a local group was there meeting up.  Either way the Spanish band was fantastic.  I love live music! and people were dancing salsa.  It was very loud and I could hardly hear what my date was saying.  The food was just ok for me.  There was not a lot of seafood options of my liking, but I made do with was was there.  It was so so.  the fish I had was very tangy as if it was seasoned with lemon juice.  Everything else was good! I give it an A for atmosphere and and B- for food!  that's my food truth!

Super disappointed! And after reading the first few post on Yelp we should have walked out! But we gave it a chance.
Nothing like a "Real Cuban Restaurant" An hour before even getting there the phone rings...rings...or busy but when someone finally picked up and I asked I was put on hold forever and he NEVER came back on!! The hostess said it would take 45-to an hour wait. After an hour wait we are still waiting but we 2 big groups of people to sit. When I approach the hostesses reminding her I been waiting and I was there prior to those groups. I was told they had reservations lol!!! WOW!!!! 
Finally we got to sit down to a table with nothing!!! No water!!! No Cuban bread with butter!!! Crackers!!!!NOTHING!!!!! 10mins later the waitress decided to show up. By this point we had our order ready. No "oh give us a min" we told her everything we wanted. When the food comes out she tells me they ran out of fried banana?! HELLO?! Seriously?! For the prices they charge the portions are small!!  My breaded steak was brunt, the chicken my step daughter got was super small and my husband steak was very skippy!! 
Not sure why we ordered cafe con leche more or a disappointment!! It was rusty!! Then they only have just plain flan?! Once again even more disappointing!!
I'm honestly convinced the owners are not Cuban this would have NEVER happen in Miami or Jersey!! This is why Cuban restaurant never make it here in Charlotte. Considering this is the ONLY!! One how they made it around this long oh yea because people do not know how bad it is!!!!

One of the hidden gems in the greater Charlotte area.  Amazing Cuban food (recommend the garlic shrimp), great atmosphere, authentic mojitos and very reasonably priced.  You will not leave disappointed.

I met some friends for lunch here on a monday. When we walked in, we were seated promptly by the host and given menus. The atmosphere was very nice, and we were looking forward to our meal.

Unfortunately, our waiter seemed as if he didn't want to be there. we waited about 20 minutes for drinks, and another 20 for him to come take our order (and he only came over because we were all staring expectantly at him). He never came to check on us once, unless we got up to get him, or flagged him down (which was difficult, as he never seemed to look towards the tables, instead keeping his head down over the screen to the POS ordering system).

Once the food came, everything was delicious, flavorful, and well prepared. Such a shame that the horrible service ruined it for us.
This is my favorite spot.  I love everything I have ever ordered.  The plantains are always cooked just right and the service is wonderful.  Very authentic Cuban food!!!
Crispy beef OH MY! Delicious food. Live entertainment. Good people. I still don't think they cooked my food in olive oil like the waiter said though...

In Atlanta, there was a shack of a Cuban restaurant that was so authentic they had a picture of the raft they came over on (I'm not kidding about that). I ate there at minimum once a week.
While not quite as good, this place has been the closest I have found so far. Definitely a lot more upscale than my Atlanta spot, which had bars on the windows, but the food was really good and reasonably priced.
I had a beef empanada and the Media Noche. The Media Noche was pretty good but the empanada was outstanding. If I had any room in my stomach, I would have ordered 2-3 more of them. 
They place is tucked away at the end of a strip mall but now that I've found it, I'll be back.

Went with a prearranged large party. Service was terrible, because the support staff was not supporting our waiter. Drink orders were taken once, delivered, some to the wrong people, and almost never thought thought of again. When they finally took or orders (40 minutes after we arrived) it still took another 40 to be served.

The food was far from good either. The seafood and chicken in all the dishes was overcooked and tough. The only reason our drink and water glasses got filled was because all of us were asking. No one even came and asked how the meal was.

I spoke to the owners, a husband and wife, and while she was somewhat apologetic, she several times tried to lay the blame on our group for not telling them what to do. Hey, hears an idea - how about you the owner come over and see if everything is okay.

In the end we were served three complimentary flans, but it didn't make the situation any better, especially since the came out over cooked and burnt on the bottom.

I don't think any of us are ever going back.
Nice place!, very good service, and very good food at average prices....Havana sampler app was very good way to try all the "basics", and all were very good...

I ordered at dinner a Delicious veggie platter -under salads! Came with veggies and plantains! I ordered with yellow rice and veggies .Beans would be a perfect addition as then would be a complete protein! All delicious! Colorful and I will be back! 
Husbands Mahimahi was good but he felt portion was on the smaller side, flavorful though!

Disappointed...we wanted to try this restaurant. We arrived 25 minutes before they closed, and the restaurant was almost empty, but we were told that they couldn't seat us because they were going to close. You only get one chance to make an impression, folks.

Go someplace else. Had dinner here and we spent $50 (with no drinks) and left dissatisfied. We left thinking the only thing that was enjoyed were the plantains. It is a clean restaurant with attentive service though.

Visited October 2013

Was pleased to find this restaurant in North Carolina, the Cuban sandwich was a miss But the plantains were good as well as the flan. Fried steak was a tad over cooked. Black Beans were excellent. Service was attentive and I look forward to trying some of the other dishes.

Even if you have never had Cuban food before, I am sure you will find something you like on the menu.  Definitely worth trying!

Service:  Excellent.

Ambience:  Nice outdoor seating - don't feel like you are in a strip mall at all.  Inside has plenty of seating, nice decor and a bar.

Food:  Have eaten there several times and tried something new each time - great selection on their menu.  The food is very good.  Nice flavor and cooked correctly.  Portions are good.  

Price is fair.
Quiet place for a quick lunch. Nice, low music, service was great, had the Cuban sandwich with the green hot chili sauce, absolutely amazing & tasty.

This is one of my favorite restaurants and the price is very reasonable. Start with a Calle Ocho Mojito. They grind mint leaves into it and use cane sugar. 

I typically get the chicken empanadas and the shrimp in garlic sauce. The shrimp includes either yellow rice or plantains. I like to double up on the plantains. For dessert, I get the coconut flan and two cuban coffees. Awesome! The food is great. The service is good.

There is live music on Friday and Saturday nights.  It can be a bit loud.  If that is an issue for you, there is outdoor seating.
This food is decent however the service is incredibly slow so if your in any rush don't nothing coming.

The place looks nice and has great customer service. The live band is amazing and plays great music to dance. But, the food is awful to say the least. There is nothing authentic about it. There were 8 of us at the table and no one liked their food. The appetizers were so low on salt that they didn't taste like anything. Our entrees were all cold and taste was horrible. You could tell the food was not fresh and just been reheated upon serving. Honestly, it is a shame that the food is not good as their ambiance and music is amazing. In my opinion the owners should really look into having better quality when it comes to food. Also, although the service from our waiter was good, it did seem they were very pushy all the time asking what else were we going to order when we really wanted to take it slow. Have some appetizers at first and drinks. Then order our entrees, after all a place like this is inviting for you to stay the night consuming and dancing. Yet it seemed like they wanted us served and out. Mind you, we were a party of 8 consuming and there was no waiting line of people wiating to come in. Honestly, I would love to go back only for their music but would definitely not eat here again. I really hope one day they actually serve good authentic Cuban food with quality as this would probably help the business a lot.

Came here one weekend night with a group of friends.  The food was delicious and authentic. The black beans and rice are a must. Make sure you finish dinner with a Cuban coffee! This would be a 4 star review if not for the speed of service. Our waiter was extremely polite and great at providing recommendations, but our drinks went empty more than once and we were almost finished with our main dishes before our sides showed up. That being said, I'd have no reservations about giving them a second chance.

Very nice interior, welcoming and friendly staff, and a solid Cubano sandwich make this place a must try.  The prices are extremely reasonable for a night out with the family.  I have been living in the Charlotte area for 4 years now and don't think I have had better service and friendliness from any other area restaurant.  You just can't go wrong by grabbing your next lunch or dinner here.  I have also been with large groups and they are very accommodating and keep the drinks full!

As a Cuban, I always look for a Cuban place and visiting Charlotte,I decided to try this and it was good. The drinks were excellent- great mojito and margaritas. We ordered the Havana sampler that is so worth it- tamal, pork,Maduros, tostones, yuca, croquetas, and empanadas- the tamal was the only disappointment - the rest were great!
I ordered the rabo and it was ok- not like the one at Versailles- and the rice was a major disappointment- hard and old. The yuca with mojo also was not up to par.
Overall good music, good drinks, great cortado . The rice was a disappointment and not worthy of Cuban since in general, the Cuban rice is fabulous.

Coming from NJ where Cuban restaurants are aplenty, my expectations of quality authentic Cuban food are high. I am pleasantly surprised to find this restaurant meets my expectations. The food was delicious and the atmosphere supported the authenticity of the food. I am looking forward to becoming a regular.

This was the second time we had lunch in this joint.  First time I had the crispy shredded beef and the woman had a Cuban sandwich.  Both were pretty good along with some tostones and plantains.   Crispy beef was a bit oily but I ate every bite of it.  This time I had the garlic shrimp and tostones and boiled yucca and the gal had some skirt steak with rice and beans and a couple plantains again.  Skirt steak was ordered well done and was a little chewy which is expected cooked well but did taste good.  The garlic shrimp was decent some where cooked better than others, I like my shrimp cooked longer, more well done, a couple were that way and a few were softer, not as good.  Yucca was perfectly cooked and tostones,  well, it's hard to mess up a tostones,  so it was good as well.  Service was good, waiter was very attentive,  didn't have to look for him for anything.   Food was out in good time, place was busy for a lunch crowd.  I will have to try it one night for dinner, looks like the drinks are worth trying as well. Adios for now.

I went last Saturday. All the reviews said service was slow so I expected slow. To my surprise service was great. They were full capacity and service and food great. The best of our table was the ribs OMG EVER BODY said the same thing FANTASTIC. I hade the steak which was great. The chimichuri Sauce  great. I will be back a great find. Yucha fried yummy. The appetizer platter was a not miss

After hearing several co-workers brag on this place I had to check it out, I love Cuban food. The two of us got there at 7pm on a Monday night, were seated right away, there was 4 other tables with guests inside and 2 outside. Some were just having drinks. There were 2 servers, 1 bartender and 1 cook from what I could tell. We ordered within 10 minutes and we had the Starter Family meal that has a combination which is perfect for introducing someone new to Cuban food like my guest. We had , shredded Pork, Grilled Chiken and specialty thinly sliced, pounded sirloin. We also had Plantains, white rice and black beans.  We had to wait about 30 minutes after we ordered which seemed long given the low crowd in the restaurant. When the food came it smelled great but was luke warm and it almost seemed like they had forgotten about us given the time and temp ? I did not send the food back (which is rare for me) because it was all together. Despite the coolness, the food still tasted great. Full of Cuban flavors and in the end I was content. My guest also enjoyed the food but expected a little more. Over all I will recommend them but just plan on a long wait and be sure to get it at the right temp and you'll be satisfied.

Growing up in Tampa, Florida I consider myself an amateur Cuban food foodie..... I lived on shredded mojo pork, rice and beans, plantains, ropa vieja, Cuban toast, and other Cuban specialties and I know good food....... So when another Yelper Elite and I decided to scope out a new place in another part of Charlotte.  Going back to my roots, we ended up at A Piece of Havana.  I ordered the shredded pork with white beans and rice along with a side of plantains.  She ordered the crispy shredded beef with yellow rice and plantains.  Mine came correctly and hers came with yellow rice and black beans but no plantains.  It was corrected by the server promptly after I sampled mine and determined that they were too nice to pass up! So the pork was melt-in-your mouth tender with delicious mojo seasoning..... The rice and beans were tasty but the plantains were carmelized perfectly and complimented the dish amazingly.  I WILL be back to try the Cuban sandwich! A must try in Steele Creek!

WOW is what I thought when I finally found a restaurant to take my husband to that caters to the Latino. He is Puerto Rican and we have yet to find anywhere to eat since we moved here in August, 2006. We found one place - I am naming no names - but it was not authentic and we were excited to go out to this place for his birthday dinner. We got there and were seated quickly. We loved the atmosphere and thought surely the service and the food would measure up...NOT - it took forever to get our drinks, we had a party of 5 - including 3 adults - and only got 5 rolls. They don't have Cuban bread! They even only brought 3 pats of butter. It took the waiter several times to understand our order so when it was my husband's turn to order - he ordered in Spanish which the waiter still didn't seem to understand. Our food came out with the white rice cold, the tostones cold, the plantains cold - my chicken soup never came - the waiter said he thought I said I didn't want it??? My Chicken Milanesa was not supposed to have onions but I bit right into one! The tostones were soft not firm - the yellow rice was weird - not authentic and I have had plenty of arroz amarillo in my day. We asked for more bread on several occasions and it never came, nor did our refills. When we asked the last time for more bread - we were told it would take 7 minutes!!! We told the waiter of our dissatisfaction and he didn't say too much. When the check finally came - the waiter said - the owner gave you a discount and some coupons...A 10% discount off of a $55- $60 bill! The coupons were what they would give anyone - buy 1 entree and 2 drinks and get one half off! I will never go back here again! What a waste!

As a native South Floridian partially raised by Cubans, I know my way around Cuban cuisine. Reading through some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to go to A Piece of Havana, knowing that my hopes and dreams of a walk down memory lane could easily be dashed. Suffice it to say, I'm glad my fear of disappointment didn't get in the way of my need to reminisce. 
We went at kind of an off time: 3pm on Saturday and there were very few people there. We were greeted and seated right away, then the fun began. Our server was delightful, especially since she was helping me persuade my fellow dining compatriots to enjoy some adult libations with me. 
Mojitos, Cuban bread, crispy shredded beef, Havana chicken, shrimp, black beans and rice, and Cuban coffee...?! You can't go wrong and I'm excited to go back.

I've been here a couple of times now..I've gotten the same Cuban sandwich. Awesome both times. Not dry, seasoned right. However, this time I got a drink. No complaints onthe taste of the drink. Actually it sad quite strong with excellent taste, however, I had to go to the bar area to order it. The place wasn't crowded and I arrived after the rest of my party, but I still expected service. They still deserve a 5 star because all else was fine. I just really wanted a drink. :) Customer service regardless for what needs extra attention..

I tried this place on the recommendation of coworkers. I was hesitant but was in the mood for something different. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was very good, restaurant was clean and enjoyed the Cuban music playing. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars was the service. There are some good and not so good members on the waitstaff. Waiting thru most of my meal for someone to come by to see if we need anything was a bummer. Any good waiter/tress will stop by a few minutes after food is served to check on the table. I will continue to keep dining here despite the spotty service.
Decent mojitos.  Food is O.K., but way overpriced for portions that are not very generous.
This was a great spot. Even better experience. My wife & I loved it. Food was awesome.
Good food and good drinks!

Atmosphere. Dark 
Service : friendly 
Food : meh ... i ordered  the yellow rice  and veggies which tasted like it came out of a box of Goya Spanish rice and was have been here for a while . The tostones were also kinda old tasting . The chicken Milanese  was pretty tasty . Ice tea was flavorless . All and it was not terrible but it wasn't great either . I so wanted to like this place . Perhaps I should have order something else ?
This place was awesome. Live music, delicious Cuban food & beautiful atmosphere. I highly recommend this place if you love Cuban food and live music.

Oh man, I was such a fan of this place but the quality of the food is so inconsistent, you never know if the food will be good or mediocre. But the WORST part about this place is the blue hair girl that works front of the house. OMG I have never met someone so entitled and rude! I am guessing she is the owner's daughter bc there is no other way you would have someone with such poor people skills in the front. It is so bad that when you go during their peak hours and are waiting for a table, random people bond over her horrible service. She is so rude to customers and the rest of the staff, it seriously puts a huge dent in your dining experience. 
I do want to note that everyone else in the staff is great! Always nice, polite and very helpful!
Music and environment was entertaining. I went specifically for paella and was disappointed. Will return to try another dish.

1st time trying Cuban food and it did not disappoint! The food, the drinks, and the service was great! We really enjoyed the atmosphere and the live band was a nice touch to seal the deal.  We'll definitely be returning in the near future!
nice cuban dandwich recommend?crisp bread with grill pulled chicken and ham with fries  Nice for a lunch.

LOVED the crispy Beef with Rice & Beans and Pantains!!! Amazing! I will try the Cuban Sandwich during my next visit. There is a small stage and dance floor....I assume there's a live band during the week. Service was great and the food was amazing. I plan to attend a live show next visit.

I've been back to A Piece of Havana twice since my initial review.  I have not encountered the snooty person as on my first visit and have found everyone to be very friendly here.

On my second visit here, I just went with something listed as a favorite on the menu and it was decent, just not something I was expecting.  On my most recent visit, I asked my server for a recommendation and he recommended a shredded beef dish. 

Now I am not a big beef eater but this dish was absolutely amazing.  The crispness of the beef is what did it to me along with the chimichuri sauce.  For a side item, get the green beans!  They are very flavorful.  The fried Yuca was good too but I've had better at a Peruvian place.

I spent a little time talking to my server and I think this is a place I will bring the dinner group very soon.  I've never been here for dinner and some of their menu options they only offer for dinner so I am looking forward to trying them.

One odd thing,  The chairs here are custom made.  The backs and seats seem to be made out of leather.  The only problem is that I sunk down a bit when I sat down.  I felt like I was sitting in a hole.  But that's the only flaw I saw with my latest visit.

Good stuff.  Check it out sometime!!!

Live music made me feel like I was actually in Cuba or Puerto Rico! The atmosphere was live with people dancing on this Saturday night.

 However, I didn't like the first waitress attitude as the first thing she said to us was that they were closing at 10 (we sat down 9:10). Like it's not about to close for almost one more hour! After we ordered our drinks, a different waitress took our food order. She was nice & courteous, and remained with us for the remainder of the night. 

We ordered the Empanadas as an appetizer, Chicken Hemingway (chicken wrapped in bacon), shrimp in garlic sauce and chicken alfredo as the entrees. The Empanadas and shrimp in garlic sauce were tasty. The Chicken Hemingway could have used more marinade and seasoning as it was kind of dry and bland.  The Chicken Alfredo was okay, just a different sauce that we are not used to. Overall, I would come back to hear the live music and try something different the next time.
I absolutely love this place but the amount of food just doesn't match the price. Flavors are good, servings are small. Great atmosphere and service.

Excellent food.  A real gem of a find.  Best mojo pork in the Carolinas
My wife and I came here on the recommendations of friends.  Can't than them enough.  Great service.  Great food!

Considering I've eaten twice here in 30 days I decided it's time for an updated review.

Every visit I have made to this restaurant the food has been delicious and except for my first experience the wait staff has been good.

What to try here:

The empanada sampler - they taste amazing and come hot fresh out of the oven! The dipping sauces served alongside the empanadas are a wonderful flavor addition.
The Argentinian Parrillada with Malbec - I am going to venture a guess this meal would comfortably feed 3 instead of the 2 advertised. The real surprise when we ate this meal was that on a plate of meats, including steak, I have to say the chicken was the winner! I don't particularly care for bone in chicken but it was prepared perfectly with generous seasoning and every bite was juicy! 
The Cuban sandwich - I can only get so excited about a sandwich personally but my fiancé adores this sandwich and orders it consistently when we go for lunch. 
Chicken Bacardi Alfredo - I am surprised to be saying this as well but my friend ordered this at lunch and I had some serious food envy! The Bacardi alfredo sauce was unique and delicious.

It's proven to be a solid date night location with large comfortable booths and consistently delicious food and drink specials. I am glad I went back and tried them again.

The waiter looked like he wanted to be elsewhere, he wasn't welcoming and seemed bored every time he had to come to our table. Not only was that putting us off but the food was cold when we got it and it was lacking flavor. Not interested in visiting again.

Went went on a Friday night to celebrate a friend's birthday. It was a GREAT night!  The food was delicious (we had one of the combo dishes for 2), the Sangria was fantastic, and the band/DJ had everyone on their feet!  We loved every bit of it and can't wait to go back!

WTH!?  No Media Noche or Bistec Empanizado on the menu.  Turn in your Cuban card! JK.
Jason the server was good, the Mojito and Masa de Puerco Frito were on point as was the Havana Sampler.  Would have been a 4 but you need to work on getting customers seated quicker, you weren't that busy.

I liked  some things about A Piece of Havana quite a bit. The place is very nice in terms of atmosphere, the garlic shrimp were cooked perfectly, and the wine-broth was very tasty. There were a few hiccups though; while service was friendly, it took a long time to get our lunch and my portion was on the small side. I was actually kind of hungry when I left, which is never a good sign.  Looking at other photos on Yelp it may have just been my entree- so maybe next time I'd opt for rice instead. I also thought the tostones were bland & the green beans next to them were super salty. My best guess is maybe they just salted the green beens twice instead of both of the side dishes? Anyway, I would definitely give them another shot-as overall the main dish did taste good & they have some great sounding cocktails on the menu.

Athentic Cuban restaurant. The "congri" and the "vaca frita" were excellent.  Good food all around. Good live music and good mojitos. It's hard to find good Cuban food outside Miami, this place was really a piece of Cuba in North Carolina. I will return and highly recommend this place.

Saturday noon and it was closed. It looked dirty inside, some used lime slices on one table. I tried the phone number and no answer. I went by the hours indicated on yelp or their web page so wasted a trip out there.

We went here in a whim after seeing the movie Chef and getting excited about Cuban food! 
It was amazing! We had a lot of dishes between is both vegetarian and fish and Cuban platter! 
There was great music, the other patrons were dancing ! A comedian from
Venezuela had the mike for awhile which was good if you understood Spanish! Not if you didn't!! 
Would I go here again? You bet

I visited this treasure for the first time last night. I Googled best Mojitos in Charlotte and " A Piece of Havana " popped up. I was there  celebrating my 45th Birthday. Several other parties were going on at the same time as mine so it was on fire.. First off  the drinks are great! Nothing watered down at this place. I think they have over 15 mojitos. I ordered the skirt steak, green beans and rice. The steak and beans were seasoned to perfection the rice was good as well. They have live music and a small dance floor. I was very impressed. We will definitely keep coming back.
I am from Miami and love Cuban food. They do a good job and have a really nice place. Go, eat, Easy to get to too.

Mojitos are very good.  Empanadas are delicious.  What a great restaurant, so excited that Charlotte has a great Cuban place to eat!  
If you are even considering a visit, by all means come here for a great meal.
Picadillo is also very good.  Great steak sandwich.
Great Mojitos!! Excellent skirt steak, rice and beans, fried yuca, and fried plantains!  Cool atmosphere.  Very welcoming.

Honestly, every time I come here I am extremely satiated. Only once was there a tiny blip but I'm going to chalk it up to a bad day. (There was absolutely no stuffing in the croquetas and the waiter would not replace them with fresh ones with actual stuffing) 

BESIDES THAT... 

I truly enjoy bringing friends here, coworkers, clients, my boyfriend and family here. I recently moved up to Charlotte from Miami in January so your girl KNOWS her cuban food. Although I would not really classify this as 100% cuban eats - this place does have your Cuban staples and the savory flavors are undeniable. 

I've tried their churrasco, roasted chicken (my fave when I ate meat) and most recently the grilled mahi-mahi. All were superb. Highly recommend any of these options if you are indecisive. 

They also have a pretty extensive mojito selection which I have been dying to try!

Me and my friend decided to check out this spot for drinks and to listen to music. I always wanted to visit the restaurant. The lady that was performing Wanda Lopez was very good. She had people up dancing and enjoying the music. The restaurant was full. There were a few birthday parties going on that night. The highlight was seeing Coach Riveria for the Carolina Panthers there with his family and friends while we waited. There was no one to greet us when we walked in. After having to ask for the host we were told there was no tables available. So we sat the bar. I had a pina colada without alcohol. It was too sweet. The pork bites were nicely seasoned and good. I will probably visit the restaurant again.

Wonderful!! The only reason I didn't give perfect 5 was because the space is very small and crowded and I ordered a sampler plate so that I could try multiple items, and the roasted pork was AMAZING, the steak was "good", but the chicken was "blah"....
We came here to celebrate my husband's birthday and he and I both had a wonderful time-- the band was absolutely amazing, the vibe made us feel like we were in Little Havana in Miami, everyone- patrons included- were happy and lively and having a wonderful time. If only they had a bigger space so that you didn't feel so crowded it would have been perfect. 
And again, the food was delicious, over all, but I feel on a sampler plate where they have chosen the best of the best authentic items for your to sample, everything on the plate should be outstanding. The chicken was really dry and wasn't seasoned....the steak, again, was good, but not great....the star, by far was the roasted pork...OMG!! Soooooooo Amazing! I truly hope they expand and open another one of these somewhere else in Charlotte, as I feel it This cuisine and culture is missing here(and I live in Mint Hill, so SteeleCreek is kinda far for us to get to).  Can't wait for an opportunity to return....

Nice place tucked away in Steele Creek. Service was excellent. It took a little longer than normal to receive dinner since there was a private event. There is live music  each day. The bartenders were very attentive and polite. Food was hot and savory!

I'm a huge Cuban fan and had such high hopes of this place, but unfortunately am leaving disappointed.
Ordered the Lechon Asado lunch portion with boiled yuca and plantains (my go to dish). Pork was cooked very good but the marinade was incredibly salty to the point of being overpowering. This is not normal for this dish.  The yuca was very undercooked and tough to cut/chew. Plantains were great, but also pretty hard to mess up. 
All said, the price was great at $6.95 but flavor and quality were very low too. Too bad because they have a great atmosphere for sitting in a strip mall area.

Food was tasty as usual but the service left much to be desired. We arrived around 630 and it took nearly 2 hours for our food to arrive. A couple in group received their food absolutely cold with apology or concerns about that. Makes me skeptical to return here unfortunately

Decided to try this local Cuban cuisine.  Service was great.  My shrimp scampi wasn't what I expected.  Shrimp with plain pasta and parmesan sprinkled on it.  Husband ordered a large plate that had mixed seafood and rice.  Very good!  Be forewarned, this is authentic so if order a plate that says calamari...you're going to get whole baby squid.  Not strips of calamari.  Live band plays at 7 p.m. (at least on Fridays).  We plan on going back!!
The best lunch value around.  The crispy beef is awesome.  They make everything fresh and the food is very good.  Dinner portions are enough to share.
Really good Cuban food for being north of Tampa! The Cuban sampler appetizer was great and the ropa vieja was really tasty.
Tried the mojo pork with green beans & plantains. Will def go back when i'm up that way.

This place is a local secret. If you like Cuban this is as authentic as I've found in the area. Crispy pork and plantains are the best thing on the menu. The mojitos are off the charts! Kid friendly and tons of fun on salsa night :)

I was recommended to this place by a Costa Rican friend of mine.  It did not disappoint!! My husband and I came here for dinner on a weeknight to celebrate our anniversary and LOVED it.  The Long Island Lemonade was a tasty drink to start off the night.  We got the sampler platter, and the empanadas were BY FAR the best I've ever had.  Fried plantains were perfect.  Our seafood paella was to die for.  Capped the evening off with a cuban coffee, and boy did that ever give us a jolt!  But, it hit the spot.  The tiramisu was great for a Cuban place (thought it was an Italian specialty).  Our server was so very kind and attentive.  I loved it!  Will definitely be coming back!
Very good .. had the mojo shredded pork with Cuban rice and beans and tostones .. empanadas as apps .. everything was very good!!

Pleasantly surprised and delighted with my meal.  Went during lunch.  Service was prompt and food came out fast.  Food was very flavorful, reminded me of some of the Cuban food I had in Miami.  The Mojitos were absolutely delish.  I suggest the Mango because it was made with real fruit.  The ones without fruit(peach for instance was peach flavored syrup) were still good and had the basics (lemon, mint) but didn't taste as authentic to me( though very good).  I would go definitely go again if I'm on that side of town.

We stopped in for dinner last night and had sort of a bumpy experience. As a disclaimer, this was Valentine's Day weekend, so I can understand them being stretched thin. Although, the restaurant was never totally full during our time there. 

There was PLENTY of staff to go around, but it still took a very long time for our server to approach. We placed orders, no problem, but almost never saw our server for the rest of the night. Others came around to top-off our drinks...at one point, topping off my diet soda with sweet tea. Somehow, our absentee server saw this happen and brought a replacement, which was nice. 

Food was just okay. The Cubano is not the best I've had, and the fried yuca was disappointing. We never did get silverware, and only got napkins because a bus boy spilled water on us. Also took ages to get the bill, which turned out to be for a different table. So we had to hunt down our sever again and have her fix 

Overall, the place is clean, staff is friendly enough, and they have good live music some nights. Maybe they are better on a regular night. I doubt we'll go back, though.

I really like Cuban food so this was a big disappointment to me.  Not only was my stewed beef rojas WAYYY over salted, and my sides portons absurly small, but my service  - well every one's service - all 8 of us at different tables in the place - was lacking. I wasnt the only one neck craning for some service. and I thought the pricing on the menu was a little on the high side for steel creek. Maybe it was because it was Sunday afternoon??  who knows.  Nice decor, spacious, big bar. that's the good parts and the good note I'll leave it on.....

I have been to this place several times. Time after time I always wonder why I even bother to return. The food is either a hit or miss but the service has always been a miss. It's almost as if you are inconveniencing them to dine there and for that I don't plan on returning anytime in the near future.

Second try, never returning. I've been in the industry for a long time and I understand things happen but twice within two years means management doesn't care enough to stay on top of their employees. My ceviche was good, not the best I've ever had but edible. My husband's food was just gross - seriously,  how do you mess up a sandwich and fries? The fries weren't even cooked all the way. It took the server 45 minutes to take our order, two people at our table waited 15 minutes longer to get their food, beers were warm and mixed drinks ice was melted by the time it got to our table.  We would've said something but we only saw our server twice the whole time. I wish the server didn't add gratuity because she certainly didn't deserve it, not to mention adding gratuity automatically now is against the law for a few years now. Maybe if you didn't let your servers add gratuity I wouldn't be writing this review because she may have actually tried to do her job. The one positive was the band was pretty good.

My friends and I needed a pick me up.  My girlfriend's part Cuban, my guy friend is Puerto Rican and I'm part Ecuadorian.... 

This place was like "home" cooking for all of us!  

Rice and beans, fried pork, plantains, guacamole, yucca, soup, Cuban sandwiches, mango and other fresh fruit  milkshakes,  flan ... REAL FRESH CREAMY FLAN... , tres leches cake .... And to top it off Cuban cafe au lait.

As for the decor... It was like stepping into my Ecuadorian family's restaurant in Quito... dark wood, high back leather chairs, deep red curtains and wrought iron accents, tiled dance floor ... and the service was just like family ... welcoming and generous to a fault.

Yup ... It's ALL that ... And did I mention the food is to die for... 

One of our new favorite places for sure... And one of these nights my Mamacita is going to light up the dance floor.

We came here last night to celebrate my aunt's birthday. We were greeted by Arnaldo, a friendly waiter who tended to our needs throughout the night. We were a party of approximately 20 people so our service was a little slower than it would for a smaller party. Going to dinner with a large party, a longer wait is to be expected so it wasn't a big deal. I ordered the mango mimosa and it was quite tasty!! For dinner, I had the shrimp with garlic sauce and chose yellow rice with veggies and Cuban toast as my sides. The shrimp was DELISH!! The yellow rice with veggies was a little on the salty side but I ate it all so I suppose it wasn't entirely TOO salty, lol! My husband ordered the Cuban sandwich and it tasted excellent! It was my first Cuban sandwich and I'm not a huge pork eater but ended up eating the second half of his sandwich for lunch today! The prices are reasonable but my cousin ordered a strawberry/mango margarita and it tasted too sweet and syrupy. I would recommend you try the mimosas!! Everyone was pleased with theirs! The restaurant itself is clean and the bathroom was nice! 

It was also a plus that Arnaldo was willing to hold my aunt's birthday cake in the cooler until it was ready to be cut. Little things like that make for a more memorable experience. I will be going back with my husband so we can try other dishes and have a few mimosas!!
I love this place!! The oxtails are really good and meaty...the service is really slow..
Service was horrible!  Food was cold!  I would recommend you go to Taco Bell instead!!

Delicious, 12hour slow cooked roast pork ... yes! give me some please 

I don't visit Cuban restaurants often but this one delivered in taste . $11.98 for a dinner size portion of pork , yellow rice , and black beans is a bit steep for lunch but it was worth it . the lunch portion is $7.95 but I can't imagine getting full off of it.  

Only negative I have for this visit was my coworker ordered the house sandwich and they couldn't fix it bc they didn't have any potato croquettes... they suggested a Cuban sandwich instead which was disappointing bc you get a Cuban anywhere . However, huge plus for giving a discount for the inconvenience.  

Service was fast, friendly , and I love it when my drink is always filled .

After a recent visit to FL and enjoying a great Cuban meal there, we decided our craving for Cuban food was worth 30-mile drive to give Piece of Havana a try.  We were not disappointed!

We started the meal with two mojitos, and a pork empanada for me and the soup of the day for my hubby (Ajiaco Cubano for Saturday).  I loved the empanada - it was the perfect portion, it wasn't too greasy, and the pork filling was very flavorful.  My hubby also enjoyed his soup which was full of meat.

For our entrees, I had the fried pork chunks with white rice and plantains.  The rice was nicely flavored (with butter?), the pork was crispy but a tad dry, and the plantains were nicely cooked and not too sweet.  This was a great value for $9.95.

My hubby had the crispy shredded beef with yellow rice and black beans for $10.95.  His rice was just as good as mine, and the beans were well flavored.  We actually preferred each other's entrees, and so we switched halfway through.  His beef was topped with a delicious chimichurri sauce that made the dish for me.

We didn't have room for dessert, but we had to try their Cuban coffee.  Basically, it's sweetened espresso.  They were a tad sweeter than I prefer, but the coffee was good and strong.

Service was fast and efficient.  The dining room is also very nice, and we had a spacious booth for the two of us.

I haven't tried any other Cuban restaurants in CLT yet (really, there aren't many!), but given the great food, prices, and service, we'll definitely make a return trip to PoH very soon!

Went there last night and the service was absolutely horrible. It took 1.5hrs to get our drinks, mind you our table was right next to the bar.  The waitress was clueless. The food came out 3hrs after ordered...some over cooked, some undercooked and some didn't even get their food at all. My salmon was burnt, dry and served with no dressing  (see picture below). They had the nerve to bill us for food that we refused to eat. Not to mention, the bartender made my drink and was licking and sucking his fingers in the process. My friends wine glasses were dirty with lipstick stains on it. When confronted about the drinks, they got an attitude. I will never eat there again.
Food was ok. I got a beef dish wirh yellow rice. The cilantro sauce is so good! Live entertainment was awesome! Very busy and very slow service.
Good and atmosphere was amazing. Def felt like I was not in Charlotte for a couple hours.

I grew up in South Florida and have a Cuban mom so I know Cuban food. Unfortunately A Piece of Havana does not quite get Cuban food right. I am not saying the food is bad. It is just not Cuban. Other reviews here who claim to be Cuban or from South Florida and give this place rave reviews, I am not sure what Cuban restaurants or food they ate.

Let me give you a few examples. Their Cuban sandwich has mayonnaise in it. Cuban sandwiches do not have mayonnaise in them. They douse their Palomilla steak with Chimichurri sauce. Palomilla steaks do not have Chimichurri sauce. They put soggy onions on their Palomilla steak. Palomilla steak is supposed to have either raw onions or lighly cooked but still crispy onions on it. They put raisins in their Picadillo. I have never ate at any other Cuban restaurant that they put raisins in their Picadillo (although I have been told that some Cubans do cook it this way). And their white rice is completely off. Lacks the flavor or consistency of real Cuban white rice. If you want an example of Cuban/Colombia white rice done properly, head over to Los Paises instead (which BTW is great and truly authentic Colombian food).

To me it seems like they have "Americanized" their meals so it lacks the true Cuban authentic feel and flavor. Again the food is not bad, but it is just not "Cuban" to me.

I have been to A Piece of Havana many times throughout the years. I always go back hoping it improves since unfortunately we don't have many other choices here in Charlotte when it comes to Cuban food, but I always come away disappointed. The service and food quality is also very inconsistent. I can say that some of my meals here have actually been very good and they did get the rice right, but most of the time it is mediocre and the rice is completely off. One time we were seated and had to leave after waiting for 20 minutes when no one even came by to take our drink order.

I also made the mistake of coming here once on a Friday night. They had a live band going and we were seating right next to the band. It was extremely loud and we could not even hold a conversation. As other reviewers pointed out, you don't need a bunch of amplifiers and speakers for such a small space.

Ultimately this place down in South Florida would close pretty soon after it opened as it wouldn't even compare to some of the even more mediocre places. I am not expecting a Versailles or even La Carreta, but would love to see something on the level of a Latin America Cafeteria. Too bad this is not it. Ever since Carlos Cafe closed down, I have not been able to get a decent Cuban meal in Charlotte.

My husband and I came here twice. I want to talk about the second time.

We went on a Valentine's Day, and I had to go up to the bar to get my water refilled, since the waitress didn't refill it. The bartender just laughed at me as he refilled my glass. The hell? Who laughs at customers who need something? My husband noted that his meat was incredibly dry, and I had specifically asked for my order to be cooked a certain way, and brought it up with the waitress. This girl had a pretty huffy attitude, didn't even apologize and at one point even uttered an incredibly sarcastic, "Awwww, really?" Rude, rude, rude. Normally we get a flan when we go to a Cuban restaurant, but we didn't stick around for dessert this time, since we were pretty appalled by the service and the horrible quality of the food.

I would have hoped things have gotten better since our last visit, but from the looks of some of these reviews, they haven't. Piece of Havana? More like Piece of Shit!

Stopped by here for lunch since it's close to work and have heard great things about this place.  I wasn't disappointed.  

I ended up ordering the roasted chicken based on the recommendations I read on here.  It was surprisingly crispy being that it's grilled.  The chicken was accompanied by mixed rice and beans as well as some green beans.  Everything was equally delicious.

The menu had a lot of items that had me salivating so that definitely means I'll be back!

First of all there was great atmosphere.  Live music was playing on the Friday evening that we dined.  There was also nothing to complain about the service, however, more importantly the food was very good.  Not only were the portions plentiful, but as someone familiar with Cuban cuisine, I can honestly say that everything here is authentic.  In our party we had a little of everything.  To start the Havana platter had a nice selection.  The empanadas were especially good.  The congri and roasted pork was a favorite.  We will definitely visit again.

The food was delicious. We ordered the Red snapper and another sea food dish that showed two lobsters in the picture but it only came with one. They need to update the picture to only one lobster. We was expecting two lobsters since the dish was $30.00

Worst experience ever! Don't get me wrong... place was beautiful and clean. I came in with a discount dining coupon. I was with my two kids both under 12. It happened to be kids eat free night and I ordered the items from the kids menu. My discount dining dollar value for a meal at up to $12. I ordered a meal for myself which was just under $17 and an additional meal for $12.95. A few minutes later the waiter came back and said I would not be able to order from the kids menu because I couldn't use a dining dollar discount certificate and get the kids meal free. I said OK I will order something else. I ordered a meal for $9.95 for the kids to share. I knew that once I presented my discount certificate that the service would be somewhat poor. The waiter never came to check on us. I had to call on another waiter to go and get him when my daughter needed to refill her drink. He never came and asked us if we need anything else. He never asked if we wanted desert or anything but showed up with a box and the check and proceeds to tell me that he only took off 9.95 and not the 12.00. Ridiculous. I tried to protest and he gave me a so sad too bad look. There are just way too many restaurants here in Charlotte for me to give them my business. The food was OK.

More like A Piece of Heaven!  The fried snapper was delicious.  It was fresh and filling, it comes with two sides: I recommend the plantains and yellow rice w/veggies.  You MUST top off your meal with a cup of their Cuban coffee...AMAZING!  We will definitely be back soon.

Went there for lunch on a Friday. Place looked pretty busy. I ordered the pork sandwich with onions and French fries. Although the sandwich was skimpy, it had a good flavor, but I only found about two onion slices. It could've used some more juice on the bread.  The fries weren't crispy and had the sandwich had more pork on it, it might've been worth almost ten dollars. I'll give it another chance, tho. Overall, the sandwich was good and everyone deserves a second chance.

Urggghhh where do I begin. We made reservations for 8pm on a Friday which making reservations is a must especially on the weekends. We arrived on time and was seated right away. After we were seated we waited 20 minutes and no one had even came to our table to greet us. So my boyfriend got up and went to the hostess who came to our table to take our drink and appetizer order. Another 10 minutes past and a guy that seemed to be our waiter brings us our drinks and ask if we wanted appetizers to which we told him yes that we had already ordered them. Another 20 minutes later we received  our appetizers. A little crazy as we have now been there for over 40 minutes. We quickly ordered our entree when our "waiter" brought the appetizer because we didn't know when we would see him again. We waited another 20 minutes no food. The staff looked disorganized with their full attention on a large party celebrating a birthday. I needed some air so I walked outside and told my boyfriend if our food is not here in 10 minutes we are leaving. He talked with the "waiter" who went to get the food. Finally at last a Christmas miracle came and our food came over an hour after we arrived. By this point I was over it and over the lackluster food. Never again. If I was completely exhausted and hangry I would have spoken with the manager.
Great Cuban food and fast service. They are my go to place for Cuban food. Give it a try who knows that thus could be the best food to eat out at.

I wanted to really like this place but I've had mixed experiences there.  I went a few years ago for drinks and salsa dancing which was super fun.  We've tried to go back at least twice later in the night on a Saturday to dance again and for whatever strange reason either they were closed or did not have a DJ to do so.  

There is very little for a vegetarian to eat on the menu which was disappointing.  A coworker had lunch here recently and it took forever because she said the waiter totally forgot about her :/
I don't know about food but the Mojitos and music are great! We def have a fun time every time we go!
Poor service.there is a star because it wouldnt allow to post without it.but that star is not from me

Amazing experience for my mom's birthday that coincides with Cinco De Mayo. Live band was absolutely amazing . I couldn't sit still in my sit. We danced the night away. The atmosphere was welcoming. Mojitos, so many flavors, yummy  food. Definitely coming back and definitely recommend.

Pro Tip: Every 3rd Friday there's live music and dance lessons ( Call ahead to double check)

A Piece of Havanna... NOT the piece you want. 

1.) Service: TERRIBLE! We got there and it was not busy. It took our server (Juliette) 10 minutes to come and take our order for water. We ordered immediately so we wouldn't wait all night. 

2.) Food: The food was decent. I ordered a steak and my wife got the shrimp scampi. Everything had great flavor. My steak was overcooked for ordering a medium temperature. 

3.) Drinks: ALSO TERRIBLE! I ordered a raspberry mojito. If you like the taste of children's cough syrup, then this is the drink for you! On top of that delicious flavor, they will charge you $9. I recommend you go out and buy a mojito mix instead of wanting to have a terrible after taste in your mouth.

Ok, I've gone twice to this place. WILL not give it another opportunity. First time wife and I walked in and waited to be seated, and waited and waited.  Waiters passed us by and NOBODY greeted us or bothered to tell anyone that we were waiting to be seated. In fact, a guest there called what seemed to be the owner's son to seat us. At that moment again no greeting and only said...ILL BE RIGHT BACK.  This was about a 25min wait while standing in front of the hosts podium!  Wife and I walked out. It was then when a woman ran out the door to call us back. That moment we decided to leave because of the lack of professionalism. Ok. So I gave it another try. This time with some buddies and my 25year old nephew. Well dressed but wear a baseball cap. We walk in and he was immediately told he must take hat off to enter.  Of course he took it off and held it in his hand.  While seated he was asked to leave if he was going to hold the cap in his hand. Mind you, HE TOOK IT OFF HIS HEAD but apparently having it in his hand was a big enough offence that he was asked to leave if he continued to hold it in his hand.  In all. There will not be a strike three because I WILL NEVER RETURN to this OVERATED so called establishment.

ZERO stars. Can't say they don't try but the "food" is NOT Cuban, does not taste like any Cuban food this 50yr old Miami born Cuban-ish person has ever tasted or cooked. Makes me want to open my own place to show them how it's done. Not one to ever want to see a small business fail, but they need a new chef(s) to support their menu and their Cuban food claim. Really.

It's alright. 

I've been for lunch during the week a couple of times, since it's so close to work. The service is S-L-O-W, like, sloth on tranquilizers slow. Getting there, ordering, receiving food, and getting the checks is over an hour ordeal, and I don't know how many more times I can go here before I get called out on it...

Anyways, the food is usually pretty decent. I got the crispy shredded beef, and it was drenched in oil. Soaking. I don't know if anybody else has had this problem, but it definitely dissuades me from ever ordering this again. Flavors were altogether good on this though! The plantains were nice and crispy on the outside, but the yucca was seriously under seasoned. Just kinda a disappointing experience. Not enough to never make me come here again, but it's going to be low on the list of places I want to return to.

Ok so I'm giving them 5 stars if you love empanadas and mojitos, they have chicken, beef, and ham/cheese empanadas. Mojitos they have 13 options. I've never had bad service but I must admit I get empanadas, white rice, and black beans every time I come, come Friday night for a great live band.
OK for vegetarians as we have to survive off the side dishes. Great for non-veg folks, lot of options.

FIRST OFF, I AM CUBAN. How does one ruin a Miami Cuban  Sandwich?? It can be done. The bread was so hard I could barely chew it and had to discard part of it. I took half the sandwich home to give to the dog. The roast beef on the sandwich was tasteless, very small amount of ham, and the Swiss cheese was there, but heated away outside of the sandwich by their sandwich press. So much mayo it dripped out when trying to bite the hard bread. I NEVER had nor put mayo on any Cuban sandwich I made or got in Miami. I didn't taste any pickles on it, either. I would have sent the sandwich back but I was with my son. I won't go back. I can cook my own Cuban sandwich much better. It's a nice place, the employees, are very professional & friendly.

I am a Fort Lauderdale transplant that greatly misses diverse foods.  I was stoked to find this place.  I had the Palomilla Steak for lunch and was not disappointed.  The food was well prepared, the atmosphere was very comfortable, and the service was great.  Definitely recommend!!

First impression: The location is nice and had a great atmosphere. We were greeted immediately and given a table (not that they were busy). I enjoyed the decor but I will say that their leather chairs were a bit uncomfortable.

Nothing like Cuba Libre in DC (amazing decor!) but for NC it is a great ambiance. Now about their food...
  
*sigh*

What a disappointment when I drove almost 2 hours to eat here. I got here about an hour before closing and I guess that wasn't enough time since our waitress was rushing us to order. We came here to have this GRAND experience and left with nothing but a decent steak sandwich that I ordered after my disappointing meal (that she put TOGO without asking and I had every intention of eating it in the restaurant). My mother started off with a sangria which she gave it an "OK" it was on the sweeter side but still a decent sangria. Between my parents they split a Paella (which was huge) but they had no lobster! It also came with no sides and cost almost 30 dollars. The Paella was good but not the best, the rice was not fully cooked and the clams were closed shut! I on the other hand ordered their garlic shrimp with yellow rice and sweet plantains..... and I will never order that dish again... ever. I figured out their special sauce! The shrimp was overcooked and was chewy and the "special" sauce overpowered the dish.... all I can say is... Mojo Criollo anyone?? The yellow rice was cold and all I enjoyed was my sweet plantains. 

I will come back again with an ample amount of time and hopefully the food and service will be better. I love Cuban food and thats the only reason why I can't turn my back on this place just yet!
I deem this place middle of the road.  Seating is comfortable and the noise level is low - good for a business lunch.  But the food is average at best.  Did not "pop" with flavor.

When I was feeding my car down by Carowinds Blvd, I used my new(er) BFF aka my droid phone Yelp app to locate a new place for lunch.  The truth is I've been condemned to un-cultured, un-worldly food for way too long.  I was determined to get some real taste back in my mouth before it goes on strike.

Who knows there's a cuban restaurant in the suburbs!  The location is obscure... a little strip mall off Tryon (right at Moss).  Something about Cuban/Latino music, it just brightens the day (and the place).  Ok, so the service was slow (no one sat me, but to their defense I was standing by the hostess stand looking at the menu, I think they thought I was a to-go customer).

Lunch menu (smaller portion) is only available during the week.  So I went after the sandwich (didn't feel like breaking my bank for a quick solo lunch).  Instead of the old standby Cuban sandwich, I tried the Miami Sandwich.  It's like a Cuban with with lettuce, tomato and mayo and ham croquettes.  I love croquettes.  I also orderd the soup of the day, Ajiaco Cubano.  

The soup was tasty.  Though it's very brothy (not as much as stew-y as it's described during my quick research online).  It definitely wasn't creamy like the waitress said.  But nonetheless it was good.  My cup ($2.95) had a piece of fatty pork and a little yuca in it.  

The sandwich ($8.95) itself was ok.  The pork was a little tough.  That's the disappointing part. (side note: best freaking Cuban sandwich EVER was the one I got in DC in the market... see my old review).  The bread was good, and the mayo/mustard added to the taste.  I definitely enjoyed the croquettes, which were being deliciously smushed by every bite I took.  The sandwich was big enough for me to save half for later.

I substituted fries with plantains maduros.  I'm a sucker for sweet plantains.  And they were good.  But is it possible to mess up sweet plantain?!

Overall it was an ok experience.  The waitress was nice, but I can see if it's busier (the place had 3 other tables at the most, virtually empty) the service would be slow.  The pork was the least impressive.  But I was happy, I was very very happy that I haven't lost my appreciation for REAL food :)

It's really unfortunate that I'm giving this restaurant a bad review. We've been here a couple of times and our first visit was okay. Our second visit however, was absolutely terrible. We came with a group of friends before a church event. There were eight of us in when one of our group members went in to get a seat, the restaurant told us that they did not have space for us. At the time, the restaurant was completely empty and they continued to turn us away. Eventually, my friend had to beg to be able to eat there, and they allowed it as long as we promised to leave by 8 PM. 

The staff must have felt frustrated about having to serve us after claiming that they did not have space. The server was extremely rude and inattentive. She rolled her eyes several times and was extremely impatient. 

Several people in the group had made an order for chicken. While our food was being made, one of the servers came out to tell us that there was no chicken of that type yet and suggested that they replace it with a different kind of chicken. We agreed and that's what they served. However once we got our check, The three of us that had ordered the chicken found that we had been upcharged for the chicken breast. This was completely unacceptable, considering that the change made in the menu was made by the restaurant. And needless to say, the meal was sub-par as it could not be prepared in its original, authentic way. 

It took more than 30 minutes for us to get our meals. Overall it was such a disheartening and disappointing experience. We were there for the joy of authentic Cuban food and hospitable service, and we did not get either. To be completely honest this experience was enough to deter me from going back. I hope that The staff could be more mindful about the customers' needs.

I'm no chef Ramsey but disappointment from what I tried last night. I left the restaurant hungry. I really wanted to enjoy this experience but it was far from it. Waiter was slow. He was acting confused from the very beginning. I didn't understand that. I love when there is a language barrier because I feel like the food would be more authentic but not for this case. I ordered a Cuban sandwich. It was cold. The bread was dry and not even hot pressed. Ham was cold, mealy sliced tomatoes, mushy mess of ham croquettes, cheese had started to solidify. So opposite of what I was expecting. Also fries were soggy. I really wanted this place to be good because just moved from Wesley chapel and miss Bella Fresco Cafe and Gelateria in the Arboretum. Bella's I would have no problem recommending but not Piece of Havana.

Returning to A Piece of Havana to meet a friend for dinner, still an outstanding restaurant.

I opted for one of their skirt steak dinners, which arrived accompanied by a few plantains and two scoops of very tasty rice. Not a huge meal, but a decent portion. The steak was cooked perfectly, though the steak knife was appreciated. It was melt-in-your-mouth though not cut-with-a-fork. Great flavor with some spices but also the taste of the grill.

Service is excellent at keeping drinks refilled, clearing dirty dishes and generally staying on top of things without being annoying.

As we were leaving, the live music was getting set up. I understand that they also do some salsa dancing here. This place would be a perfect date night.

Not real cuban food. Over priced. Very over seasoned. And the black beans are from a can they just added seasoning and heat then up. I got Ropa Vieja. Shredded beef and it had extreme amounts of garlic/salt/ oil. They are famous cause they are so far from Miami. If you think this place is good, you haven't had cuban food before.
You won't think you are in Havana or even Little Havana, but it's not a bad place to grab lunch if you are looking for something different.
Friday night live music deserves 5 stars alone!! It's amazing! The band is incredible and will make you want to dance. The food is average. Not the best but the ambience and music makes up for it!

This was a good restaurant. Coming from Miami, the food was good.  The cafe con leche wasn't as sweet as I'm used to, but it was good!! The rice and beans tasted excellent. The servers are nice and it's great getting to speak Spanish with other people here in Charlotte.

Like many other reviewers, I did not have a good experience here. Service was slow and the waitress was absent-minded. We went on a Saturday, and got there early enough that it wasn't yet crowded. 

But the food is what really disappointed us. My churrasco (skirt steak), came out very overcooked (I had asked for it medium-rare).  Not even a hint of pink in it. It had also been pounded with a meat tenderizer until it looked like a cube steak. I sent the steak back, and the next one came out a bit less overcooked, but still no where near medium-rare. 

My husband's picadillo was even more disgusting. The meat was ground so fine it was about the texture of canned cat food. It was covered in a gloppy tomato sauce. Normally a picadillo has things in it, like peppers and olives. None of that in this version, just meat ground to an unrecognizable pulp with tomato sauce.

Both entrees came with black beans and rice. The rice was mushy and completely unseasoned. The black beans were also woefully underseasoned. We had tostones with our meals instead of the standard maduros. The tostones were overly soft and very greasy.

I agree with previous reviewer would suggest Carlos Cafe in Rock Hill. The food is always well-seasoned and cooked to perfection, and the service is great as well.

Love this restaurant! The good is always tasty and the atmosphere is always fun! On Saturday nights they have live music and dancing... Great to participate in or just as background noise.

The BEST part is their mojitos! They're huge, strong and inexpensive! 

My only complaint is there's always a long wait.

Stumbled across this place tonight. Being new to the area and craving Hispanic food I decided to give it a try. The wait was about 30 minutes, but it was worth it. They had a live performer singing. My food was so delicious with large portions. Def will come again
Sat down at the bar at 1220... I am now leaving at 1247. I was never acknowledged. Watched as the bartender bussed tables. I will not be returning.

Feels like I'm back in Miami. The vaca frita is THAT good! It's light and crispy, no greasiness. The empanada sampler is also tasty ... but filling. Could be a meal all on its own. Live conga band covering great music from the 80s tonight (friday). The location of this restaurant however isn't quite right; A Piece needs to relocate closer to Center City, maybe Elizabeth or Central Ave.

This is another place where I've been to a few times but have just gotten around to writing my first review.  First off, the service is great.  The servers are friendly and always willing to explain the menu if you have questions.  
For lunch, it gets a bit busy even when it's not full.  It's more of a sit down, and you may have to wait a bit.  But, things may have gotten better because dinnertime seemed to be almost quicker.  Maybe an extra chef?  Who knows.
The food itself is great.  The lunch specials are good deals, but even the dinners are reasonably priced.  You can substitute sides, but I usually go with yellow rice and black beans.  The maduros are good and not too sweet.  I had the gaunabana shake which was a bit different.  Probably won't get it again, but it wasn't terrible.
I'd definitely recommend this place to people who want something different, but it's a bit heavy so don't go if you are looking for something light.

Super tasty food. We all usually get the same thing each time. I get the pollo ala plancha. It's tangy thin chicken. Lish. Then I get white rice and black beans. Today I tried the beef empanadas with yellow rice and black beans. Awesome. My brother always gets the chicken sandwich and yucca. Service is a tad slow but it's worth it.
It was my second time here and it was so good! I had the breaded fish stuffed with shrimp and avocado and it's delicious!!!! Also the fried yuca as an appetizer tasted amazing.

My wife and I love this place. First, make a reservation on the weekend or you'll have to wait in line. Second, make it around 7 pm, so you can hear the live music.  Get the fried plantains and avocado dip, and a mojito to get started. apps, music, mojito. Everything else is extra. Enjoy!

This is the best Cuban food my husband and I have found north of Miami (we lived there for a number of years and moved up to the Carolinas about 8 years ago). Delicious mojitos and caipirinhas, the best yuca I've ever had (the recipe changes daily so you probably won't get the same one twice). The place is always packed so reservations are highly encouraged. Seriously go, you'll thank me!

I went to Charlotte with my family for New Years 2017. Wanted to eat and listen to Latin Music. This place had both. I didn't eat as I wasn't hungry. Family did and they seemed to have enjoyed their meals. I really enjoyed the music. It was a life band of about 4 members and these boys were jammin' ! The played Cuban and Latin Jazz tunes. They also played american classic instrumentals like "Hotel California" in Latin Jazz. Cool stuff. 

The ambiance was receptive and well dressed as some hung out at the bar as they listened to the music and had a drink, while others even danced. This is a place I'd go to again !

Hit and miss, depending on how busy they are.  Sometimes they bring out bread, sometimes they don't.  The "mariquitas" appetizer is good; the "Havana sampler", not so much.  The vaca frita (crispy shredded beef) is good; the "fried pork chunks", not so much.  We've made reservations several times: sometimes they'll seat us right away, sometimes they'll try to put us at a two-seat table right in the middle of the dancefloor and the greeter will argue with us when we tell her we reserved a booth.  The live music on Friday nights can be pretty loud, if you want to have a conversation.

I really wanted to like Piece of Havana, but was instead horribly disappointed. This place fell flat in every single way it could.

Let's start with the service.  It was severely lacking.  There was barely anyone (only 2 other tables) in the entire restaurant and it still took an obscenely long time to get anything, from our initial drink orders to refills to even our food.  If they were slammed I could understand, but the waitstaff spent most of the time chit chatting or watching one of the TV's mounted on the wall.

Now, the food.  I don't believe my standards are unrealistic.  There's plenty of good Cuban food to be found outside of Miami, all it takes is a little effort.  Also, it shouldn't be overpriced.  We're not talking foie gras or lobster here.  Sadly, this place suffered from both bad and expensive food.  

First of all, the Cuban salad was a joke.  It was the bare minimum needed to be considered a salad and clocked in at 8 dollars.  There wasn't even a dollar's worth of ingredients on the plate.  Then there was the Vaca Frita which should have been called Vaca Greasy.  It was served in a little bowl swimming in grease and fat.  There was nothing Frita about the dish with all the meat hanging limp and dripping oil.  The chimichurri sauce was equally greasy and unappealing.  I'm not even going to talk about the rice and beans (a staple dish of any Cuban restaurant).  Suffice it to say, I've had better at Taco Bell.

The one thing they did well where the Mariquitas and the avocado dip.  That's it.  The best part of the entire depressing meal was the appetizer.

This was a bad experience across the board.  I don't understand why such little effort was put into what could otherwise be a fantastic place.  The decor is great, they have a solid looking menu, and the right ambiance, but it fails at the very essentials of any restaurant, food and service.
